story:
UPDATE: We have been working 'round the clock to make this campaign the very best it can be.  We have come to a conclusion that $1 for every $10 funded during this campaign will also be donated towards the Susan G. Komen.  Here is your chance to wear a great brand and also help out an amazing organization at the same time!

Amped Apparel was started by Adam Sinz at the age of 17 years old while attending high school.  A few years prior at only the age of 15, Adam was influenced by the action sports scene and more specifically the clothing industry and design.  He  always wanted to wear the the latest and greatest threads from the brands that he loved.  Adam was given the opportunity to design a t-shirt for a local skate shop to sell in their store as the "official" shop tee.  From that day on, Adam was extremely interested in graphic design and began messing around on the computer more often because he realized he had a knack for art.  It wasn’t until late 2008 that Adam had decided to put all of his designs into motion and create a brand that represented his action sports lifestyle.  Starting off a little rocky with the official know-how of marketing a brand, Adam took his clothing line to his entire high school and sold out of his first t-shirt design in days.  It was at that point Adam knew this was something he wanted to do for the rest of his life.  It was his passion and he was extremely dedicated to accomplish what he was working for...Amped Apparel.

            Fast forwarding into the future... Coming up on only five short years of existence, Amped has grown to the national level including a website for fans across the country to purchase from.  For quite some time, Adam was doing research and design in a new area that was of much interest to him and that idea was eyewear.  He released his first set of eyewear in the Summer of 2012 and with much surprise, the release went over extremely well and sunglasses were flying off of the shelves daily.  Over the next year, Adam developed additional colors and added another new style to the line up.  The eyewear line evolved into a large focus for the brand with endless routes to travel.

     Adam needs your help to complete his journey in creating the next extension of what will be known as Amped Optics.  As many people can understand, launching a brand into the market place requires a large capital investment.  Your pledge will go towards research and design, production, and marketing and advertising.  We want to get these on shelves at a retailer near you.  We have met and located the manufacturing companies that we want to work with but we need your help.  Every contribution small or large will help Adam proceed though the design and developmental stages of launching a brand that will allow people to see the world differently.  So please, pledge now and be amount one of the first people in the world to be rocking a sleek, new, affordable, and attractive premium eyewear brand.            


 

Your pledge today will get you a pair(s) of our newest, most anticipated eyewear yet; The Emils Series.  Choose between black on black, brown with gold trim, or midnight blue with rose lens.  Properly branded at 4 locations, you are bound to attract some attention.  The Emils come equipped with UV400 protected lenses to shades your eyes from the most harmful rays.









Each year Amped Apparel gives back to the community by working hand in hand with cancer foundations.  We pride ourselves in helping positive people who want a brighter future and will not give up.  Amped also donates large amounts of clothing and accessories to Goodwill and other apparel organizations to put clothing on the backs of people who are less fortunate.

At this very moment, we have teamed up with International model Ashley Alexiss to release a t-shirt to support October's breast cancer awareness month.  In addition, $1 per every $10 funded during this campaign will be donated to the Susan G. Komen For The Cure Foundation.



1) When can I expect to see my perk packages?

We will ship out all perk packages in December, just in time to rock your Amped Optics for early spring AND before the general public!

2) What styles and colors wil I be able to chose from when I pledged?

Our newest, most anticipated eyewear yet.  The all-new Emils Series has 3 colors ways to chose from(pictured above).  Once the funding campaign ends we'll be in contact with you to follow up on our progress of design and development and give you the inside sneak peak of what we're working on so you can choose the styles and colors you'd like.

3) What if i'm not the Emils style?

We really want to spread the awareness of our all-new Emils Series to world however if they are not your style, please do not let that hold you back from pledging.  Your pledge also allows you to choose from our classic ever so popular Crossover Wayfarer as well.

4) Do you ship Internationally?

Yes, we do however there may be an addition shipping fee that you will have to cover.  Sorry, we try to be as cool as possible, but give us a break

We would like to thank every backer for any contribution and any assistance in the realization of our project.  Share our concept of Amped Optics amoungst friends and relatives young and old.  Together we will bring the new age of colorful, affordable and sleek Optics to life!

If you have any questions or you just want to say hello, be sure to contact us at sales@ampedoptics.com

Questions regarding payments, please contact info@ampedapparel.com

Questions regarding press or any other advertising, please contact info@ampedapparel.com

at the age of 17 years old while attending high school.  A few years prior
at only the age of 15, Adam was influenced by the action sports scene and more
specifically the clothing industry and design.  He  always wanted to
wear the the latest and greatest threads from the brands that he loved. 
Adam was given the opportunity to design a t-shirt for a local skate shop to
sell in their store as the "official" shop tee.  From that day
on, Adam was extremely interested in graphic design and began messing around on
the computer more often because he realized he had a knack for art.  It
wasn’t until late 2008 that Adam had decided to put all of his designs into
motion and create a brand that represented his action sports lifestyle. 
Starting off a little rocky with the official know-how of marketing a brand,
Adam took his clothing line to his entire high school and sold out of his first
t-shirt design in days.  It was at that point Adam knew this was something
he wanted to do for the rest of his life.  It was his passion and he was
extremely dedicated to accomplish what he was working for...Amped Apparel.



            Fast
forwarding into the future... Coming up on only five short years of existence, Amped
has grown to the national level including a website for fans across the country
to purchase from.  For quite some time, Adam was doing research and design
in a new area that was of much interest to him and that idea was eyewear.  He released his first set of eyewear in the Summer of 2012 and with
much surprise, the release went over extremely well and sunglasses were flying
off of the shelves daily.  Over the next year, Adam developed additional
colors and added another new style to the line up.  The eyewear line
evolved into a large focus for the brand with endless routes to travel.
     Adam needs your help to complete his journey in creating the next extension of what will be known as Amped Optics.  As many people can understand, launching a brand into the market place requires a large capital investment.  Your pledge will go towards research and design, production, and marketing and advertising.  We want to get these on shelves at a retailer near you.  We have met and located the manufacturing companies that we want to work with but we need your help.  Every contribution small or large will help Adam proceed though the design and developmental stages of launching a brand that will allow people to see the world differently.  So please, pledge now and be amount one of the first people in the world to be rocking a sleek, new, affordable, and attractive premium eyewear brand.            

 Your pledge today will get you a pair(s) of our newest, most anticipated eyewear yet; The Emils Series.  Choose between black on black, brown with gold trim, or midnight blue with rose lens.  Properly branded at 4 locations, you are bound to attract some attention.  The Emils come equipped with UV400 protected lenses to shades your eyes from the most harmful rays.















































Each year Amped Apparel gives back to the community by working hand in hand with cancer foundations.  We pride ourselves in helping positive people who want a brighter future and will not give up.  Amped also donates large amounts of clothing and accessories to Goodwill and other apparel organizations to put clothing on the backs of people who are less fortunate.
At this very moment, we have teamed up with International model Ashley Alexiss to release a t-shirt to support October's breast cancer awareness month.  In addition, $1 per every $10 funded during this campaign will be donated to the Susan G. Komen For The Cure Foundation.







1) When can I expect to see my perk packages?
We will ship out all perk packages in December, just in time to rock your Amped Optics for early spring AND before the general public!
2) What styles and colors wil I be able to chose from when I pledged?
Our newest, most anticipated eyewear yet.  The all-new Emils Series has 3 colors ways to chose from(pictured above).  Once the funding campaign ends we'll be in contact with you to follow up on our progress of design and development and give you the inside sneak peak of what we're working on so you can choose the styles and colors you'd like.
3) What if i'm not the Emils style?
We really want to spread the awareness of our all-new Emils Series to world however if they are not your style, please do not let that hold you back from pledging.  Your pledge also allows you to choose from our classic ever so popular Crossover Wayfarer as well.
4) Do you ship Internationally?
Yes, we do however there may be an addition shipping fee that you will have to cover.  Sorry, we try to be as cool as possible, but give us a break




We would like to thank every backer for any contribution and any assistance in the realization of our project.  Share our concept of Amped Optics amoungst friends and relatives young and old.  Together we will bring the new age of colorful, affordable and sleek Optics to life!
If you have any questions or you just want to say hello, be sure to contact us at sales@ampedoptics.com
Questions regarding payments, please contact info@ampedapparel.com
Questions regarding press or any other advertising, please contact info@ampedapparel.com

story:
About Wrap Up Africa

Wrap Up Africa is utilizing a market-based approach to provide sustainable employment and address the development challenges associated with cancer in Africa.

Wrap Up Africa (WUA) is creating and managing initiatives that help tackle the unacceptable healthcare inequities of cancer care in Africa with an entrepreneurial twist.  In addition to striving to improve access to cancer care in the communities where we work, we are creating employment and opportunities for our tailors, their families, and craftspeople.

Our goals are two fold:

First, develop a beautiful, high quality global fashion line that will generate the required revenue to ensure sustainability of the organization and provide empowerment and employment opportunities to our tailors and their families.

Second, improve knowledge about cancer and assist cancer patients with the access to the best possible treatment and supportive care in order to control pain, improve quality of life, and extend survival.

Our Products

WUA’s artisanal products are hand-made by our trained tailors and locally skilled tradesmen and women. Grounded in African design, modified for Western markets, we craft each individual garment to best utilizes the rich tapestry of African fabrics and natural resources. Our textiles and findings are sourced through local markets, often with added elements from neighboring Kenya and Ethiopia. To further enhance their beauty, we commission local artisans to create decorative design finishes out of clay, bone, metal and wood. Each day, our team overcomes extraordinary challenges to create a single piece of original beauty, continually exceeding the expectation of clients, company, and self.

Our Journey

Wrap Up Africa has been hard at work training tailors since 2007. At the beginning, all of our tailors were new to sewing, and so all of our products had to be simple to construct. Over time, their skills have grown with continued practice and training. A few years ago we realized that we had a pool of well-trained tailors who were capable of making beautiful, high-quality clothes. We decided that it was time to create a new line of products and Tailor’s Uganda (TUTU) was born.

Our vision for the TUTU line is to create a beautiful collection of clothes that stands on its own merit in terms of design, construction, and beauty with a unique point of view and brand identity. We want to push the boundaries of what people expect to see from products made in Africa and showcase the creativity and beauty that can be found there. By working with local artists and crafts people in addition to the most skilled of our tailors we are creating something very special.

Our clothes have been on a journey of becoming. They have taken time to evolve along with the skills of our team. We love to think about people buying them and how our customers' stories, at least in part, align with ours. Wrap Up Africa’s TUTU becomes a part of our customers' journey and they carry a piece of us along with them.

Your Contribution

Your tax-deductible contribution will enable us to cover production costs for our fashion line, which provides jobs to cancer patients and their families, provide specialized training to our Uganda staff members, upgrade our equipment, market the collections to retailers, and take it to trade shows in order generate sales. Our unique clothes are made by tailors working to meet the extraordinary challenges that accompany a cancer diagnosis in Uganda.

The Impact

All of our tailors are family members of cancer patients working to meet the cost of care and support for their patient. When you wear our clothes you can feel as good as you look. Wrap Up Africa is working to increase trade with Africa by producing 100% of our fashion collection in Uganda. A 1% increase in trade to Africa is equal to three times the amount of money Africa receives in aid annually.

We are also building long-term, sustainable opportunities for our tailors, local artisans, and manufacturers. We are working to help build better infrastructure that will not only support us but also other local businesses and to encourage new investment and community-building initiatives in Uganda.

We believe that when people and business work together to tackle big challenges, anything is possible.

We believe that applying an economic solution to a development challenge will help bring about a lasting change in Africa that aid alone could never accomplish. Furthermore, the market has demonstrated that “doing good” is good for business. Increasingly, customers are seeking products with a social impact, so where and how a product is made has never mattered more. Retailers and manufactures are beginning to recognize the shift in customer attitudes and the value of working with companies like WUA. WUA provides a way for companies and their customers to engage with social change while having a positive impact on their bottom lines.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the news about our campaign with friends, family, people you meet at the grocery store! Use your favorite social media to share our story. Follow us with the social buttons below. You can also:

  • Visit our online shop and check out our new clothes!
  • Follow us on instagram: @wrapupafrica 


*With our deepest gratitude, we would like to thank Gail Mooney and http://openingoureyes.net/ for the use of the video.

story:
Starting with the Cupcakes & Champagne Brunch kick-off event Sunday March 30th, we want to raise $2000 to produce the zine issue and fashion show. Our budget will go towards printing costs, more pages, better quality, artist compensation and wider distribution. 

Masconsumption started as a blog, and soon became a zine. After I came to New Jersey's Valley Arts District 2 and half years ago I wanted to create something to chronicle the revival growing there and at ORNG Ink Studio for Emerging Artists. 

Spring 2014's Women's Issue is the sixth Masconsumption publication and I couldn't be more proud to be the editor of this zine. It has continued to be a collaborative project with the artists, writer, photographers and other talent existing in the Valley and has featured over 70 artists and collaborators. 

The quarterly zine is produced and distributed in the arts district, located in Orange/West Orange, New Jersey. The release events are a way to engage the community, give featured artists and musicians exposure, collaborate, gain experience, network and of course have fun! 

Last issue (Winter 2014's The Music Issue) was released at Hat City Kitchen, with the first Hip Hop showcase in the Valley. The next issue, is dedicated to female empowerment, and will be released at a fashion show.  This is the project we want you to be a part of!

story:
We are building the definitive Online Social Platform for the Sports Enthusiast.

We live in a world rife with hardship, conflict, uncertainty, and change. This is nothing new, of course. Change always has been and always will be one of the constant forces that humanity faces. Yet, no matter what kind of change shakes our little blue orb, there is another constant that stabilizes us and provides us with comfort and camaraderie. For as long as human beings have sought to make positive sense of the world around them, there have been Sports. Our sports, our games, our teams, and our players are a conduit into which we pour all our joys, worries, aspirations, and dreams. Sports are always there for us.

In the age of social media it is so much easier to connect with the world around us. However, as we develop more “connections” with friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and myriad other social platforms, the significance of those connections start to wane. With an increase in the quantity of our social ties, we witness a simultaneous dilution in the quality of those relationships. We believe what is missing is context. In erasing the boundaries space and distance play in relationship building, those relationships have become less grounded. As a result, our world is becoming more fragmented than we care to admit. At Sportscircle, we want to utilize the wondrous possibilities of social networking by tethering it to a central theme. A theme that is universal, ancient, and, perhaps most vitally, human. Sports.

We invest so much of ourselves into our teams, for reasons as numerous and mysterious as the human soul itself. Whether we're rooting for the hometown club, a particular athlete, or a nation representing our cultural heritage on the world's stage, sports informs us emotionally. For so many of us, following sports can take on a feeling of spiritual significance, of joyful obsession. We pour over statistics in almanacs and articles, scream urgently at our televisions when our teams fall that inch short. And we make friends, some through our enthusiasm for the same team and some for the giddy thrill that only a great rivalry can provide. And yes, you do have to mow your friend's lawn next weekend. The sports bet is sacred!

With the Olympics, we are transported back to the origins of sport. We are enlivened by a deep feeling of national and global camaraderie, a sense of pride in the athletes that represent us, as well as in ourselves. We empathize. We celebrate. We connect. Once every two years, the world chooses to give itself over to an ancient bond that bridges divides of both physical distance and history. Sportscircle wants to take that feeling and place it in the arena of social media. Our mission is to show the world that the great things we see in ourselves and admire in others during times of great athletic competition, is always present. The digital age has already provided us with a wealth of spaces for social activity. Sportscircle wishes to go a step further by using sports, the world's greatest social glue, as a jumping off point for forging new connections and strengthening those we already have.

Sports unite complete strangers. It is a bond that spans cultures and generations. Put a large group of people who don't know each other into a room, and sports are sure to come up in conversation. Imagine, you are at a symphony performance. As the violins and cellos play, it’s beautiful and in sync and you’re enjoying yourself. However, when the climax hits, everyone is silent, waiting for the next chord to drop, and in that moment you are all of one mind, one body, one soul. This is what the bond sports enthusiasts feel when they watch a football game together at a crowded bar as a last second “Hail Mary” is launched into the air. When the receiver catches or drops the ball, the entire bar erupts and collective celebration (or agony) ensues. But, in either case, a group of disparate people has been moved to see and feel something as one.

Sports inspire us. In spite of whatever corruption and scandal may dominate today's headlines, sports so often reminds us of what continues to be good in our world. They remind us of the values that make not only good athletes, but good human beings: hard work, integrity, and fair play. Sports are filled with people who strive for excellence. Watching these people, whether as fellow athletes or as a devoted spectators, makes us lift our sights a little higher and encourages us to set new milestones for our everyday lives. Sports make us part of something bigger than ourselves.

Sports allow belief in the impossible. Do we believe in miracles? That "anything-can-happen mentality" is like nothing else in the world. Like life itself, we think we have it all figured out, when suddenly the impossible happens. The #1 team loses, the unbeatable record is broken. The realization that anything can happen kicks magic into the air and stirs the little kid in all of us to once again ask, "Why not?"

Sports engage our competitive nature. It provides an outlet to the primal desire to become better than who we are. It takes those heroes we revere and shines the mirror of greatness back at us. In sports, justice translates as fairness. In sports, we expect that the "rules of the game" will be strictly enforced. We demand fairness, and we insist that every athlete be judged on his or her merits as an athlete regardless of race, creed, color, country of origin or anything extraneous to talent. The rules that govern sports are held sacrosanct and we come to understand how errors have consequences. And, at the end of the day, the final call stands and we move on a little wiser than we were.

Sportscircle is for all of us...any of the billions of people worldwide who are sports enthusiasts. The casual fan that simply want to meet other fans, the recent college graduate looking for a place to watch the game in a new city, the mother seeking recommendations for sports for her kids to play, the athlete looking for other athletes to train and share tips with, the trainer looking for people to train, the competitor looking for training or nutrition tips, the rabid sports nut looking for others to chat with, the fan looking to buy or sell tickets, the ex athlete looking to put together a neighborhood pick-up game, the student-athlete looking to attend college, the Fantasy sports junkie. Come share your passions, your experiences, your successes and your setbacks. Share your insights on training and competition.

Join us. Help us. Thank you.

Share your insights on training and competition.

Join us. Help us. Thank you.
campaign_city: San Francisco Bay Area, United States

story:
Our Story

This past fall, Chloe and I attended the first Kiva U conference, a three-day seminar hosted by Kiva.org.  There, we learned all about the micro-finance industry and the tremendous impact small loans can have on the lives of budding entrepreneurs all around the world.  What was most memorable about the long-weekend however was not the knowledge we gained, but rather the stories we heard.  Throughout our time there, we listened to many incredibly inspiring individuals recount how they worked their way out of poverty utilizing self-discipline, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a couple of micro-loans.  

We left the conference feeling truly moved.  Upon arriving back home, we asked ourselves, "How can we continue spreading these powerful stories?"  Out of that conversation, Kin Threads was born.  Ever since, we've been researching, designing, and laying the groundwork for a company that we believe will truly better the world.  

That brings us to right now.  The only way to really get this project going is with a little bit of start-up capital.  We've located some entrepreneurs we want to help, have built some clothing collections around their stories, and now just need some money to manufacture these clothes and to build a website on which to sell them.  

That's where you come in.  In supporting us today, you're helping start a company that will go on to better the lives of individuals and communities all around the world.  


What We Need & What You Get

More specifically, we need funding for two things: 1) The creation of a fantastic website & 2) The purchase of inventory. 

What you'll get for your contribution is outlined below:

For $5, we'll send you a hand-written thank you note letting you know just how grateful we are for your contribution!

For $10, we'll send you a personalized thank you picture with a special handwritten note on the back explaining how much we appreciate your help!

For $15, we'll write, record, and videotape a personalized thank you song!

For $25, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads knit beanie.

For $35, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads v-neck.

For $50, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads sweatshirt.

The Impact

Ultimately, we are all about helping people who want to work their way out of poverty. By supporting us, you're helping to start a company that will spread the message that entrepreneurship is the key to economic development.  You're investing in an organization that will consistently help individuals, families, and communities by spreading their stories to the people who need to hear them.  


Check us out on Facebook and Youtube!

https://www.facebook.com/KinThreads

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyKQ_ZBTenNlb528nIEiHuw?feature=watch
story_txt:
Our StoryThis past fall, Chloe and I attended the first Kiva U conference, a three-day seminar hosted by Kiva.org.  There, we learned all about the micro-finance industry and the tremendous impact small loans can have on the lives of budding entrepreneurs all around the world.  What was most memorable about the long-weekend however was not the knowledge we gained, but rather the stories we heard.  Throughout our time there, we listened to many incredibly inspiring individuals recount how they worked their way out of poverty utilizing self-discipline, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a couple of micro-loans.  We left the conference feeling truly moved.  Upon arriving back home, we asked ourselves, "How can we continue spreading these powerful stories?"  Out of that conversation, Kin Threads was born.  Ever since, we've been researching, designing, and laying the groundwork for a company that we believe will truly better the world.  That brings us to right now.  The only way to really get this project going is with a little bit of start-up capital.  We've located some entrepreneurs we want to help, have built some clothing collections around their stories, and now just need some money to manufacture these clothes and to build a website on which to sell them.  That's where you come in.  In supporting us today, you're helping start a company that will go on to better the lives of individuals and communities all around the world.  
What We Need & What You Get
More specifically, we need funding for two things: 1) The creation of a fantastic website & 2) The purchase of inventory. What you'll get for your contribution is outlined below:For $5, we'll send you a hand-written thank you note letting you know just how grateful we are for your contribution!For $10, we'll send you a personalized thank you picture with a special handwritten note on the back explaining how much we appreciate your help!For $15, we'll write, record, and videotape a personalized thank you song!For $25, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads knit beanie.For $35, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads v-neck.For $50, we'll send you a limited edition Kin Threads sweatshirt.The ImpactUltimately, we are all about helping people who want to work their way out of poverty. By supporting us, you're helping to start a company that will spread the message that entrepreneurship is the key to economic development.  You're investing in an organization that will consistently help individuals, families, and communities by spreading their stories to the people who need to hear them.  Check us out on Facebook and Youtube!https://www.facebook.com/KinThreadshttp://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyKQ_ZBTenNlb528nIEiHuw?feature=watch

story:
Sáráhkká is a tiny, tiny clothing company located in Oslo, Norway, where we until now have been doing all the fantastic creations. At the beginning of 2014 we will travel to India to do some more textile magic. We wish to expand and make a larger collection, for both women and men. It is the first time that we are making something like this. And we are EXCITED!

Our focus: Natural, beautiful, glam hippie, practical, comfortable, extravagant, “outside the box”, festival. 


Project Funding 

So far, we have completed multiple designs and are now working with the patterns. Our wish is to make a completely eco-friendly collection, and to make this dream come true, we need your contribution, feedback and support. This is where you lovely Indiegogo supporters come in to play!

The money raised from this Indiegogo project will fund our first big collection, expected to launch in festivals summer 2014. The 3000 dollars we have asked for will be put directly into fabrics, threads, other materials and production. In case we do not get fully funded we will still do this project, but in a smaller scale.

We encourage any donations. As a special offer for the Indiegogo project we are offering some *surprise items from our new collection, of different designs, colors and sizes to everyone.

*Pictures of the items will come up in april / may 2014, where you can choose color and size. Until then there will be a description of the item. Some of the garments will be further developed from the First Collection, that you can see in the pictures in this campaign. Same style but better! NEW for this year will be the long awaited MALE clothing. You will LOVE it!

Any donation of $1 or more is greatly appreciated and you will recieve a sneak peak of the coming collection.

However, if you like our project but cannot contribute financially, we understand, but would really appreciate if you spread the word to others via our other social media platforms, Etsy and Facebook. Like our Facebook site and follow our adventure in India and the coming festivals next summer.



About Sáráhkká

We started our company in spring 2013. Sáráhkká is a collaborative studio; a team of two young women from the north of Sweden. Christina Lindgren and Nadja Björk are together the creators behind all the designs, the sewing, marketing and the photographs. Our passion for travelling, clothes and nature brought us together. 


Products and Designs

Sáráhkká is creating something unique, a production with long-lasting, good quality clothes and accessories with an extraordinary style, that will make you look smashing. The garments and accessories can be mixed in various ways. The deep mystic forests of the north, fairytales from around the globe and historical eras have given us inspiration.


The pictures we are showing in this Indiegogo project is from our first collection, to show you our style. The reason for this is that we have not finished anything from the new collection yet. Want to see more pictures? Go to our facebook site: https://www.facebook.com/Sarahkka


Baroque Skirt


Bohemian Circus Lace Vest, tights, tubetop and patchwork belt 

Goals

Design and production

  • Design and sketches.
  • Make the next collection in India.
  • We will focus on finding natural materials, ecological fabrics, hemp and fair-trade if possible.
  • The collection will have about 300-1500 garments and accessories, depending on how much funding we get.

Marketing

  • Visit card to web shop, homepage and blog.
  • Professional fashion photographs.
  • Product photos that shows garments / accessories shape, color and details. 
  • Blog where we show what we are working with, inspiration pictures and texts, thoughts and visions.
  • Homepage where we connect web shop, blog, Facebook page.

Sales

  • The collection will be sold summer 2014 in festivals all around Europe and at etsy.com.
  • Hangtags for price.
  • Eco-friendly fabric bags.
  • Special packaging for post orders.


Risks and challenges

  1. One of the risks in this project is the acceptance of our products by the masses. But we do believe the collection will be a success at the festivals. Statistics from our Etsy and Facebook account makes us confident that these products will be loved by women and men all around the world.
  2. This collection will be made from natural materials and as far as possible, eco-friendly and fair-trade fabrics. The big challenge will be to find eco-friendly and fair-trade materials that fulfill our demands for quality and texture.
  3. The other risk we face is the delivery time for the products. Since we will send our collection from India with the Indian Post Office, it can take up to 3 months to Europe. So even though our production will be completed according to schedule, there might be delays with the delivery. Worst case scenario is if any of the parcels is lost.




Our plan is to travel around European festivals this summer and sell our collection in an upfront and personal way. Music Festivals is a popular summer activity and fashion is always a big part of it. We assure you that this collection will be out of this world, organic beauty that is full of imagination and natural materials. It is time to start living this Dream!

Thank you!


Transparent Skirt

Oversized Hood Mini Vest 

 Baroque Skirt

story:
Introducing JS shoes: Uniquely You

"At first glance these are simple shoes with a warm feel, but they are made with cutting-edge 3D knitting technology and incorporate numerous innovations. By controlling the knitting density and shape, the shoes successfully balance durability that makes it possible to wear them countless times and a design sense with a light feel. The development of this product for the market for easy shoes, shoes for casual urban use, also provides a good feel." 

------ Evaluation by Japan Good Design Award

 

JS Shoes are the first 3-dimensional knitted shoes that have ever been designed.

JS shoes feature a featherweight, formfitting, and minimum design. The light weight design marries comfort and style - perfect for the active lifestyle of the urban resident who spends equal time in the car and exploring outside.  

Original 3D knitting technology introduction video:

 

 

Featured in:

Things you need to know about JS Shoe and 3D knitting

  • The problem of traditional shoe manufacturing: It all started from one of my very first trips to a shoe factory.   Traditional shoe manufacturing requires plenty of production lines and hundreds of laborers for the whole process. This old way of shoe making causes many environmental issues with the gluing process and carbon emission, as well as tons of wasted material during the cutting process. This has been the same method for decades. After a few trips to shoe factories, I felt that today's factory doesn't have to be this way.
  • New journey of shoe making: After tremendous studies and research, I discovered that the sock manufacturing process is very efficient and waste-free. I started to work with sock making experts and shoe experts together to find the best solution. After 2 years, we made the first 3D knitting sample based on socks and soon turned it into 3D knitted shoes with huge optimization of the manufacturing process:
  • Waste-free production: Knitting machinery knits shoes in a 3-dimensional method to produce the exact amount of materials for each shoe, ridding of any wasted material
  • Optimized manufacturing process: 80% of the manufacturing process and manpower are reduced; most of the processes are operated on computer 
  •  Completed design is sent to the knitting machine and ready to operate
  •  After setup, the knitting machine begins operation and design exactly for each order
  •  Environmentally friendly process: Energy-saving carbon reduction makes the working environment for factory workers safer. Huge reduction to manpower (up to 80% reduction compare to tradition production lines)
  •  Comfort and fit: We work with a design expert who has more than 30 years of experience in the shoe manufacturing industry to ensure the comfort and fit of JS shoes.
  • Suitable for today's urban life: Prefect for indoor and driving. JS shoes are also ideal for the urban lifestyle - people who spend long hours in an office, drive a car for daily commute, etc. JS 3D knitted shoes will keep your feet dry and breathable during the day. 
  • Award wining Design: JS shoes have won Top design awards : IDEA bronze in USA and Good Design Award Best 100 in Japan for creative thinking of shoe making and contribution to environment 
  • Ultra light: Because of the reduction in layers and materials, JS 3D knitted shoes are extremely light - one shoe weighs approximately 130 g or 4.6 oz

What our campaign is offering:

  • JS Pixel (Female)
  • JS Rainbow (Female)

High quality of knitting details (Men)

 

High quality of knitting details (Women)

 

 

Real life experience:

  • Perfect driving shoes for long drives for vacation and work, the comfortable design enables drivers to sit back and relax with minimal effort
  • The lightweight design is great for casual activities
  • Travel light -  JS shoes can be squeezed into a very compact shape taking minimum space and weight in your luggage, it releases room for other important traveling items 

 

 

We want to thank you again for your support !

story:
What if Football Manager was real? Or realer..

Managing your own real football club and watching it grow and climb the national leagues, surely thats what dreams are made of?

We're raising funds to develop a football club run by you, the supporters. All club decisions will be voted on by its supporters through a dedicated website and mobile app. This is yours, you can help vote on all aspects of the club from the name and branding to the team formations on match day.

This first stage funding aims to develop the core website and mobile app, register the club for a 2015/2016 county FA league season and acquire a team of players. All remaining funding will be placed within the clubs funding pool to be used based on the decision of its supporters. 

Through the dedication  and expertise of our supporters, we hope to grow the club and climb to the national leagues over the coming years. This will be a club you can truly support.

Club profit is given back to supporters in the form of prizes based on a points system, supporters who regularly nominate winning decisions and vote on successful match day choices will be rewarded with monetary prizes!


About the football, not the money

Crowdfund FC (working title) is a non-profit football club and focuses solely on the football. While money is required to support and run a football club, all club actions are entirely based on improving the football expertise of the club. 


So who's the club manager?

You, along with all other supporters. We are currently developing a dedicated website in which all supporters can vote on the actions of the club, from which players we purchase/sell to which formations and tactics are deployed. 


Who are the players?

You decide! Players are nominated by the supporters and then voted on, depending on funds available to the club further contributions may be asked for from supporters should the club funds not be sufficient.


How will it work?

The club will have a supported elected committee whose role is to ensure the club maintains its democratic state. The supporters will take on the role of the club manager by voting through a dedicated website and/or app on any part of the club. Supporters can also nominate potential directions for the club, for example on match day supporters can nominate a particular formation and allow other supporters to vote on the formation they feel will win the match.

All players, coaches, club name/badge, venue, ticket cost, etc.. is decided entirely by the supporters.

The club will begin within a county FA league (of which will be voted on) and aim to climb the leagues in the coming years.


If I pledge more money, do I get to vote more?

As we believe money shouldn't be the driving force in football we have decided that all supporters should have equal voting rights no matter how much they pledge. Instead we have decided to give all early-supporters who join within the first fund raising stage (yes you!) to gain 1 extra vote (2 votes in total) instead. People who wish to pledge more will earn other rewards such as season passes and merchandise.


Where will the money go?

There are certain costs involved with registering a team with the FA and entering a county based league, along with developing football kits and renting a club venue.

We will also be developing a dedicated website and app to allow all supporters to vote, the website is currently in early development stages and the funding will help us grow these services. Until our website is live voting can be taken place on our Facebook page which will go live shortly.

All remaining funding will be held by the club within its funding pool to finance club decisions such as player wages. All use of any club funding is decided upon by its supporters. 

If we don't reach our funding target then any proceeds we do receive shall still be used towards the development of the website and mobile app, our primary sponsor Jackpot7 will support us should the club lack the necessary funds. Should the club require further funds to pay players or hire venues, extra rounds of fund raising shall take place.


Who are Jackpot7?

Jackpot7 are our primary sponsors who are here to support the club with all administrative duties along with boosting our profile to encourage more supporters to join. Jackpot7 will never vote or control the clubs decisions and act as a non-voting third party simply to support the clubs growth.


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges involved with sport, primarily the lack of funding to further progress the club and challenge the well established clubs currently in the national leagues. However we believe that with the uniqueness of Crowdfund FC, the club can draw in supporters who are devoted to the success of the club. Along with the backing of our primary sponsor Jackpot7 we believe the club will be able to progress successfully.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need as many football fans to get involved as possible! Know anyone who is tired of watching business nonsense and money ruining their beloved club? Or anyone who can't pull themselves away from Football Manager? Send them here! The more supporters we have the faster we can roll out and grow our club!

story:
Our Story

We started Men of Habit in March of 2011 with the hopes of serving the intelligent menswear community with thoughtful stories, interviews, and advice that guys can't get from the sea of commercial fashion magazines that are currently available. Five months into our journey and our site has grown into one of the premiere destinations for stylish men--it is the place where they can learn about young brands, get exclusive looks at quality product well before it hits shelves, and read conversations with the most knowledgeable men on clothing and style in the world. While we have enjoyed our place on the internet and will continue to improve our content and design, we've always had a dream to create the world's best print magazine for style obsessed men. We have assembled a large team of writers and photographers to make this vision become a reality and are couldn't be happier about the long term potential of this magazine with guys like G. Bruce Boyer, F.E. Castleberry, and Derek Guy all helping with our operation.

The Impact

Currently, there is next to nothing for an English speaking man who wants to raise his knowledge about style above the low-level information he can pick up in GQ and Esquire. While the Japanese have magazines like Men's Ex, Leon, Free & Easy, and The Suit Catalog, those in America and the UK are without a print source to educate them on style and the clothing industry. With articles on Savile Row tailors, conversations with some of the best known Italian craftsmen, and personal style portraits of the the menswear industry's best, we've positioned our magazine to fill the void that is missing in the market.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we have grouped together a team of the best style writers and photographers in the industry and are working with a major New York based publisher to get the magazine launched for Spring/Summer 2012. What we're lacking is the funds to complete the layout and design of the magazine--which is incredibly important to the success of any magazine. With design complete we will be able put the stories we have planned into production and have our magazine hitting the press in a timely fashion.


The goal of $8,000 is an attainable one and every bit of money donated will be going towards the intended cause. We are confident our goal can be reached, but continuing your support past the $8,000 mark brings benefits that will further increase the quality of the magazine. Any excess of our goal will go directly into funding our content so that we can raise the production value of our photography and pay our writers appropriately. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign! The key to the success of this project is in those who are enthusiastic about menswear. Don't be shy to email chris@menofhabit.com with any questions or comments about the campaign!

The Impact
Currently, there is next to nothing for an English speaking man who wants to raise his knowledge about style above the low-level information he can pick up in GQ and Esquire. While the Japanese have magazines like Men's Ex, Leon, Free & Easy, and The Suit Catalog, those in America and the UK are without a print source to educate them on style and the clothing industry. With articles on Savile Row tailors, conversations with some of the best known Italian craftsmen, and personal style portraits of the the menswear industry's best, we've positioned our magazine to fill the void that is missing in the market.

What We Need & What You Get
Currently, we have grouped together a team of the best style writers and photographers in the industry and are working with a major New York based publisher to get the magazine launched for Spring/Summer 2012. What we're lacking is the funds to complete the layout and design of the magazine--which is incredibly important to the success of any magazine. With design complete we will be able put the stories we have planned into production and have our magazine hitting the press in a timely fashion.

The goal of $8,000 is an attainable one and every bit of money donated will be going towards the intended cause. We are confident our goal can be reached, but continuing your support past the $8,000 mark brings benefits that will further increase the quality of the magazine. Any excess of our goal will go directly into funding our content so that we can raise the production value of our photography and pay our writers appropriately. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word about our campaign! The key to the success of this project is in those who are enthusiastic about menswear. Don't be shy to email chris@menofhabit.com with any questions or comments about the campaign!

story:
What is Twin Chimneys?

Twin Chimneys is a southern-inspired apparel brand from Dallas, Texas with a focus on social awareness.  Using a one-for-one model, every purchase will help to change the world in a positive way.  

Our first promotion is with Vitamin Angels.  For every product sold, Vitamin Angels will provide 4 children with the nutrients needed to fight malnutrition.

From their website: "Vitamin Angels reduces child mortality worldwide by connecting essential nutrients with infants and children under five. Essential nutrients enable young immune systems to fight infectious diseases, helping children attain good health and the opportunity to lead meaningful and productive lives."

About the products

*IF YOU ORDER A SHIRT, I WILL CONTACT YOU AFTER THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER TO FIND OUT A SHIRT SIZE*

-Thank You

A sincere thank you from myself! None of this would be possible without you guys!

-Sticker Pack

A 5-pack of our die-cut stickers! Put em on your car, on your laptop, on your phone, the choice is yours!

-Tote 

A Twin Chimneys tote bag, perfect for your groceries or taking books to class. It will also provide 4 children with life-saving nutrients through Vitamin Angels.

-$22-T-Shirt-Your choice of any of the 4 styles

Shirt #1

Shirt #2

story:
abbecoté, a lifestyle Brand that inspires women to dress simply and comfortably while radiating Confidence, Dignity and Grace; even under pressure.

We're creating a legacy of Smart, Stylish, and Sophisticated apparel and accessories that allow women to establish their own signature look.  Each piece can be Effortlessly worn in multiple ways; on its own, mixed and matched with other abbecoté styles, or with your existing wardrobe.


“Invest the smallest amount of effort for the biggest emotional payoff.” 


The focus of this campaign is our signature piece, the abbewrap.  Toss one on over whatever you're wearing and feel instantly Confident and Sophisticated!


A single item that can be worn in over 15 different ways...and counting... 

View all 15 different ways in our Gallery!

What should I wear today?  One of life's biggest and most frustrating questions.  Save time and energy, reduce stress and decision-making.

Set a great example for your children and be an Inspiration to others...ditch the hoodies and 'frazzled' look.  Throw on a wrap and show them that everyone CAN look and feel great with minimal effort, even amidst the chaos of daily life :) 

Reduce.Reuse.Recycle - everything has a "re-purpose" and our hang tag KARMA bracelets are no exception! We've taken the ordinary and made it extraordinary...

Wear and share the abbecoté KARMA bracelet as a discreet confidence builder always within reach.

While we can’t grant world peace (just yet)…we can dress you with peace of mind.  For each abbewrap purchased, we will donate one, in your honor, to a charitable organization that helps women better their lives.   

This is truly paying it forward!

This campaign supports the Susan G. Komen Foundation and Olive Crest - Strong Families, Safe Kids.

Know of an organization that could use our help?  Contact Us to nominate them!

The modern pace of life begs for a fresh approach to how women dress.  abbecoté is redesigning fashion for redefined lifestyles.

Clothing that is easy to wear and flexible, adapting to your many activities, moods, and changes throughout your evolving life.   Our abbewrap doesn't require much from you, but gives a whole lot back!  

Wherever you go, whatever your mood; abbewraps have got you covered.


Your support will allow us to begin production of the abbewrap and expand our brand.  The more you contribute and share, the more items we will add to the abbecoté line; from branded accessories to our "go2pieces" collection of Sophisticated and Effortless clothing that speaks to our philosophy.  And remember, each purchase = donations to help improve the lives of others.  So what do YOU do?


1. Pre-order your Fall abbewraps by selecting a perk.  Our Fall wraps are a knit blend with a hint of Angora - to keep you warm without the bulk and create a soft, heathered look.

2. Pick your favorite color, or don't, and get one of each! Remember 1=1

3. All perks will be shipped at the conclusion of the campaign.

 

Wait!  There's more...  Share this campaign with your friends and stay in touch with abbecoté on social media.  Participate in our upcoming photo contests - there WILL be prizes! 

stay connected

    




And remember, your purchases help to improve the lives of others through our 1=1 matching partnership with charitable organizations!




We can't thank you enough for checking us out!  We're looking forward to welcoming you as an abbecoté customer and to building our relationship as we build our brand.  

We PROMISE, we've got you covered!

story:
Who is Nvenn?

Nvenn is a hair company that has been designed to perform. Through our easy to use hair product line, we aim to make your hair styling effortless everyday.

Express yourself. Stand out. Be your own person. That is how you make a difference in our world today.

How do we do things differently? Simple. In 3 areas - quality, sustainability, and in our community.



What You Get?

                                                 

Our commitment to you, is to use the highest quality natural ingredients.


SUSTAINABILITY is sexy! Our key ingredient, Organic Sea Kelp, is known for its sustainable properties as you can literally sit there and watch it grow! Also, Nvenn products are all packaged in aluminum which can be recycled over and over again! 

For this reason, research and manufacturing costs are high. We need your support to  get you the best possible products. Your pledge will go towards our first production run.


Testimonials


"Most AMAZING curl cream I have ever used! ... I have literally wasted thousands of dollars on curl products that haven't worked. My search is over!" - Melanie Lodenquai

"Currently using Nvenn's protect product: Absolutely love it! It definitely adds a smooth touch and shine finish to my hair, taming all the frizz. Best part about this product is I can add as much of it to my hair and it doesn't weight it down. This product will forever be in my hair regime! Highly recommend it" - Lesley Nemeth

"I use "fix" and "curl" and absolutely LOVE both of them! "fix" does not feel sticky or gross on my hair ...This (curl) is the first cream product I can use on my hair without feeling like my hair is weighed down... Oh yeah, and the big bonus: SOCIALLY CONSCIOUS... super impressed and now a customer for life!" - Ingrid Schifer de Dennis, Schif and the City



How Did I Make An Impact?

By supporting us, you support our global community with the ...

'Care Beyond Hair' campaign.

The nvenn team volunteers their time with the disabled, youth, and young children to build confidence through their hair, personal style, and living authentically. We hold workshops from beginner levels up to advanced levels.



Other Ways You Can Help

Everything you do makes a difference. Help spark a movement. Share the love; share the idea.



The Starting Line-Up

Your new invisible friend! Fabricated to be weightless in all hair types.

                  volume. heat activated hair volumizer (all hair types) reg. $30

             smooth. hair defrizzer and moisturizer (fine to medium hair) reg $30

replenish. strength restoration oil / shine infusion (for dry / damaged hair) reg $42

                           protect. heat and UV shield (all hair types) reg $30

                           flex. flexible hold hairspray (all hair types) reg. $30

              clean. dry shampoo and hair deodorizer (all hair types) reg. $32

    curl. defrizzer and curl setting activator (for medium to coarse hair) reg $34

play. cream paste and texturizer (strong hold for medium to coarse hair) reg. $30

                    texture. whipped paste (strong strong for fine hair) Reg. $30

                                  wash. shampoo (for all hair types) reg. $28

                            condition. conditioner (for all hair types) Reg. $28




Our Story 

Hi, we are Veronica and Jessica, the founders of nvenn hair and beauty. 

We started nvenn because we wanted to spark change in the world while doing something we love. We are award winning hairstylists and have been a part of the industry for a combined 20 years and it has now become a part of who we are. 

Along the way, we started to see a trend happening with the industry. The love of hair was getting lost. Products are no longer about quality ingredients and high performance; companies stopped caring about our environment and our world. It all became a bottom dollar / profit game. 

We thought what if we could make a difference? What if we could spark a movement? We created the brand to stand for something. It is about so much more than just hair... quality, empowerment & community - to name a few.

We've spent the last few years developing the line: sourcing materials, quality testing, developing our brand and engineering our starting line-up. We have released our prototypes in to the market, and we've gotten amazing feedback from our early users.

We're eager to bring our hair line out to the world, but we need your help to meet our high production costs. Preorder your products to help fund our first production run.

The difference start with us. Join the movement. Lots of Love!


Thank you for your support! <3
www.nvenn.com
Facebook           Twitter          YouTube          Google Plus         Instagram         Pinterest

story:
The highest quality of 17 oz. canvas twill trimmed with our premium full grain leather  

 Simply snap each wall into position.

Unzip the wall to start packing.

 Pack each side and zip the wall securely back into place–simple as that!

Brass colored clasp lets you easily & securely fasten your own keychain to it, so for the duration of the trip your keys stay attached to the special wool & oak keychain that snaps into the bag.

                                   

Ever finish packing only to realize you didn't leave any space for your toiletry kit? Never again!

The kit is snapped directly behind the reinforced straps of the bag. Don't worry. We've built this kit to make sure it will never fall off.

We ship anywhere in the world!
story_txt:
As featured in Travel + Leisure Magazine!









 





 






The highest quality of 17 oz. canvas twill trimmed with our premium full grain leather  






























By adding removable walls The Duffle Suitcase is distinct from every other duffle – it’s engineered to be the most organized duffle ever created!







 Simply snap each wall into position.



2 Removable Walls – Packing Options for Any Situation!


Unzip the wall to start packing.





 Pack each side and zip the wall securely back into place–simple as that!























Fit up to a 15" laptop










Fits up to a 10" tablet


















































No more rolling your tie in your shoes!










There is a shoe bag on each side of the bag!










This pocket knows how to keep a secret







Brass colored clasp lets you easily & securely fasten your own keychain to it, so for the duration of the trip your keys stay attached to the special wool & oak keychain that snaps into the bag.








Never lose your keys again










Need an extra hand? The Duffle Suitcase is happy to help with your umbrella or newspaper










5 metal feet to keep your bag from getting scuffed










The All Around Zipper Allows The Duffle Suitcase to Lay “suitcase flat” for easy packing







                                   









Ever finish packing only to realize you didn't leave any space for your toiletry kit? Never again!










The kit is snapped directly behind the reinforced straps of the bag. Don't worry. We've built this kit to make sure it will never fall off.



Double reinforced snaps keeps this kit in place





Is it your razor you are looking for?





The back of the toiletry kit





























































                                   











We ship anywhere in the world!

story:
UPDATES: CAMPAIGN DAY 1 CAMPAIGN KICK-OFF 

Out of my shyness and encouragement by my close friend Minnie Phan I have decided to create this campaign, and I am extremely humbled and surprised by the immediate response I've gotten. Thanks so much for your contributions and for those who've visited my campaign site! I truly appreciate all of the Support.

DAY 1: 11:00 A.M. 

I've officially gotten my campaign sponsored by Duke University PhD Pipeline Opportunity Program. Thank you so much to Dre.Reuben and Marcia Ming for helping me to do so. 

DAY 2

Thanks so much to “The Bahamas Weekly” Newspaper for reposting my campaign via Facebook.  I'm truly appreciative of all the countless amount of support I've been receiving! 

The above image is of my instructor and I during my first fittings. These looks are being designed and created by me for my thesis collection named "Smithy and Primary".

About Me

My name is Jasmine Smith and I was born and raised in Miami, Florida. I have been designing and making garments since the age of 12. My ancestral background is from the Bahamas. My mother immigrated to America in the late 80's.

--Having never visited the Bahamas, I have always been reliant upon stories and photographs as inspiration to my designs. 

“Smithy & Primary” represents a convergence of the energetic palette from my mother’s ancestral, Androsian home. “Smithy” signifies my love of the well-made, and is inspired by my generational roots of makers.  “Primary” corresponds to the inhibitor. My mother having immigrated to the Americas from Andros in the 80's, she marked the bar for a standard of which I live by---Limitless. This collection is dedicated to weaving together these themes through silhouettes embodying a 90s minimal aesthetic. It is designed ideally for the around the clock woman, with boundless strides of confidence.

My Goal 

My overall goal is to construct 7 full outfits that reflect this ideal customer. 

The silhouettes challenge the aesthetic of form and function, through the sinuous color ways and material cut-outs that outline the body. Through this campaign I am hoping to raise the funding for the fabrics and notions needed to make this collection come to life. 


--The apparel industry is a costly one to be apart of and with your help I will be able to create a body of work that reflects my ancestral story and my strengths of being a passionate fashion designer. 


What We Need & What You Get 

For me to construct this collection I will need at least $2500 to purchase the fabrics and notions needed to complete 7 full head-to-toe looks. Below is a chart that breaks down how the funding will be disbursed amongst my materials.

The Impact  

With Your contribution, it will create a backing for me to produce a qualitative body of work. Through past work, I have been able to make garments that reflect upon my skill set. Through your donations, this body of work will help me to display my best abilities of craft as a designer.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you are unable to help through funding, please help to contribute by sharing amongst your family and friends. Through social networking, the campaign can be shared and viewed on Facebook by the link below or feel free to follow me via Instagram for updates on the process of my work at @FASHJAZZ.

Everything counts and I am incredibly appreciative of whatever you have to give!


THANKS FOR ALL THE COUNTLESS AMOUNT OF SUPPORT!

story:
• OUR STORY

    Autumn Teneyl Designs (ATD) is a Colorado clothing company that is in need of expansion to keep up with our ever-growing fan base and customer demand for conscious, domestic eco-chic clothing.  At this time we proudly manufacture all our designs in Colorado; Our production house is unable to grow to accommodate more orders. We've found a new ethical, socially conscious sew house to incorporate into our business that will continue the local flavor of our cottage industry company while aligning with our mission to empower women to succeed in the workplace and support their own, and their children's, educational goals.

    Our Indiegogo Campaign is being launched to raise capital to purchase fabric for our new production house as well as employ a new regional work force, Southwest Creations Collaborative, to help us continue to grow.

    Southwest Creations began in 1994 and has been driven by an ambitious social mission: to alleviate poverty and build economic opportunity across generations.  They provide dignified employment to women from low-income communities, education opportunities and on-site childcare, while engaging employees and their families in improving skills and capacity as leaders.

    We feel that their mission is aligned with ours and look forward to providing work for this admirable cooperative.

 

  • THE SKINNY... WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

    $20,000 is the modest minimum required to begin successful development of our Summer '12 Collection with Southwest Creations. This includes the cost to source and purchase fabric, thread, zippers & binding, pattern-making, clothing construction, packaging, shipping & merchandising materials, and to cover IndieGoGo fees. 

    Once we reach $20,000, any additional funding allows us to work on branding our line, website & online shopping enhancements, furthering the story of this roots-grown company and to continue our gift of doing what we do best: making Real Clothes for Real Women!

  • THE DESIGNER

    Autumn Teneyl is a fashion designer and artist best known for her unique feminine, freeâ€flowing designs. In the summer of 2000, Autumn found her calling: Her fluid designs were born against the natural backdrop of mountain music festivals and the great Rocky Mountains. The mountain chic, homegrown label is owned by the designer, who is committed to an ethical and eco-conscious model in all areas of the business.  Autumn is an advocate for the environment and the human condition, and she devotes time and revenue to these causes year-round.  Autumn utilizes U.S. made organic fabrics and repurposed designerâ€end natural & synthetic fabrics to reduce the environmental burden of textile manufacturing.  ATD offsets 100% of their operational and travel costs by purchasing renewable energy credits (REC’s) and has donated tens of thousands of dollars each year to organizations such as the AIDS Foundation, Free A Child, public radio stations (KDNK, KGNU, KSUT, eTown) and environmental groups like Colorado Wild.  Every garment is handmade in Colorado, USA.

    www.autumnteneyl.com

The Inner Circle... Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Invite your friends to follow your lead via Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and Email using Indiegogo's easy share tools.

Share our cool video made by our great friend Nate McGrath & our very own Jen Tuggle on your Facebook Wall.

         Check the box to receive updates & Stay Tuned In throughout our campaign!
story_txt:
OUR STORYAutumn Teneyl Designs (ATD) is a Colorado clothing company that is in need of expansion to keep up with our ever-growing fan base and customer demand for conscious, domestic eco-chic clothing.  At this time we proudly manufacture all our designs in Colorado; Our production house is unable to grow to accommodate more orders. We've found a new ethical, socially conscious sew house to incorporate into our business that will continue the local flavor of our cottage industry company while aligning with our mission to empower women to succeed in the workplace and support their own, and their children's, educational goals.Our Indiegogo Campaign is being launched to raise capital to purchase fabric for our new production house as well as employ a new regional work force, Southwest Creations Collaborative, to help us continue to grow.Southwest Creations began in 1994 and has been driven by an ambitious social mission: to alleviate poverty and build economic opportunity across generations.  They provide dignified employment to women from low-income communities, education opportunities and on-site childcare, while engaging employees and their families in improving skills and capacity as leaders.We feel that their mission is aligned with ours and look forward to providing work for this admirable cooperative.


 



THE SKINNY... WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
$20,000 is the modest minimum required to begin successful development of our Summer '12 Collection with Southwest Creations. This includes the cost to source and purchase fabric, thread, zippers & binding, pattern-making, clothing construction, packaging, shipping & merchandising materials, and to cover IndieGoGo fees. 
Once we reach $20,000, any additional funding allows us to work on branding our line, website & online shopping enhancements, furthering the story of this roots-grown company and to continue our gift of doing what we do best: making Real Clothes for Real Women!



THE DESIGNERAutumn Teneyl is a fashion designer and artist best known for her unique feminine, freeâ€flowing designs. In the summer of 2000, Autumn found her calling: Her fluid designs were born against the natural backdrop of mountain music festivals and the great Rocky Mountains. The mountain chic, homegrown label is owned by the designer, who is committed to an ethical and eco-conscious model in all areas of the business.  Autumn is an advocate for the environment and the human condition, and she devotes time and revenue to these causes year-round.  Autumn utilizes U.S. made organic fabrics and repurposed designerâ€end natural & synthetic fabrics to reduce the environmental burden of textile manufacturing.  ATD offsets 100% of their operational and travel costs by purchasing renewable energy credits (REC’s) and has donated tens of thousands of dollars each year to organizations such as the AIDS Foundation, Free A Child, public radio stations (KDNK, KGNU, KSUT, eTown) and environmental groups like Colorado Wild.  Every garment is handmade in Colorado, USA. www.autumnteneyl.com

story:
The Blessing of Birth

According to the World Health Organization (WHO), "...the significant impact of midwives on the health of women and newborns. Midwives are essential to the delivery of quality services before, during, and after childbirth for women and newborns. A key approach of the midwifery profession is to create the conditions for women and their newborn to go through a safe, humanized and respectful childbirth experience."

I am studying to become a Certified Professional Midwife and I am very close to realizing my dream, all I need to do is complete my Clinical training by the end of this year! 

I will be traveling to  Bumi Sehat Birth Center in Bali, Indonesia.  This is an amazing opportunity to complete my clinical requirements, to study, and work with Ibu (Mother) Robin Lim, CPM.  Ibu Robin Lim, CPM is the honored CNN Hero of the Year 2012.

I have worked with birthing women as a Midwife Apprentice at Sacred Birth Place in Oakland, CA.  As well as in my roles as Doula and Childbirth Educator in my own practice, Bismillah Birth.  I have learned from many wonderful and open hearted midwives.

In order to fundraise for my trip, complete my requirements and complete my licensing exam I am hosting educational workshops, providing women's holistic health services, and selling copies of the Sunnah of Birth Reader! Your support will go a long way in helping me get certified and licensed!

I hope you will support my educational and professional aspirations!  Please see the perks below for what I am offering & see Bismillah Birth website for more information.

All fees are sliding scale with suggested donation listed in the price for the PERK!


Fundraising Goals:

  • $1500/Tuition cost to Bumi Sehat Birth Center for Clinical Apprenticeship
  • $600/Student housing cost
  • $1,800/Plane tickets to Bali, Indonesia
  • $300/Miscellaneous Travel Expenses
  • $189/Neonatal Rescucitation Re-Certification
  • $300/Yearly Enrollment Fees for National College of Midwifery
  • $350/Midwifery License Fee & Fingerprinting
  • $750/NARM Certification Exam (Required for CA License)

TOTAL FUNDRAISING GOALS: $5,789

(NOTE: $10,000 listed above was a typo that I couldn't edit once I published, forgive me!)

Your support is appreciated and your prayers are precious.

*Peace*Love*Blessings*
Sarah Husain, MA
Bismillah Birth

story:
Introducing: Le Boustique

I have had an artistic drive from the very beginning. I grew up on tour following The Grateful Dead, traveling in my families re-vamped buses. This has evolved my style into an eclectic mixture of Dead Head chic, Beverly Hills couture, indigo child, with a touch of country girl. Integrating all of my experience and passions thus far, I am going to bring to the world a vessel showcasing a collection of work from various designers, artists and of course, myself.

This vessel aspires to fuse together music, art, fashion & alternative energy. What drives this dream is a 1961 Ford bus! This mobile store will be able to travel to any event, festival, & social gathering within driving distance. It's going to be an outlet to show people how they can live the dream! My goal is to live a life of freedom, happiness, and spread conscious community to all of those who come into contact with my vision.

My dream of opening and running this vessel begins with you. I need your help to get this project started! Without you, this project isn't possible. You will help bring this dream into physical form. Together we can make a difference!

This project is part of a much bigger picture! The Becky Saves the World Tour 2012 is happening now! We are going to have a caravan of vehicles heading out across America to educate the masses on environmental topics. Le Boustique is vessel #1 to be up and running! We strive to be larger than the Grateful Dead movement. This movement is even more powerful because it will be benefitting Mother Earth!

What I Need


This ol’ lady needs a paint job, interior & exterior along with a new floor. She also needs to be revamped so that she can fit the boutique standards with shelves, racks, mirrors & a sound system. Materials will cost a dime because they will come from found objects. Fresh paint and a sturdy floor however have a price and so does the new clutch that is required to make her drive-able. All inventory collected will have certain requirements of being made from recycled materials, found/reused objects, or companies that support environmental concerns. Most of those items are already in the material possession of Mieka and you may have even seen them at various events and places where she has exhibited them. The ultimate goal & final touch is to have solar panels power the sound system, lighting, and appliances.

Financial Breakdown

Birth Phase:

  • New Clutch - $500
  • Floor - $100
  • Paint Interior - $150
  • Labor Costs: $250

= $1,000

Learning to Talk Phase:

  • Paint Exterior (w/ Labor Cost) - $2000
  • Install Racks / Shelves (Labor Cost only) - $250

= $2,250

Learning to Walk Phase:

  • 4 Batteries - $400
  • Solar Panels - $500
  • LED Lighting - $450
  • High Powered Radio - $500
  • Labor Costs - $500

= $2,350

First Day of School Phase:

  • CA Registration - $349
  • Insurance - $100
  • Gas to Los Angeles - $345

= $794

TOTAL = $6,425


 

What You Get

There are many perks to your donations on this campaign. You will receive souvenirs to remind you of the beauty that you were able to contribute towards creation for years to come. This project will be your baby that you watch grow and excel. This is just the beginning of a new generation movement! 

Le Boustique is going to have a lasting impact! I am going to inspire hundreds of thousands of people over the years! Every person that comes into contact with Le Boustique will have an experience that they can take home with them. Sometimes, even a treasure to help visually see pivotal messages towards conservation, preservation, and taking responsibility for ourselves. People will be given a sense of true self in the process and be inspired to live their dreams. Together, we can make an impact!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts towards this cause. It won’t take very much to really get this project going! Please, donate whatever it is that you can afford. If money is an issue for you there are other ways that you can help. You can spread this campaign to those you think would be interested. You can also donate your time and help with any other the above needed pieces to the project. If you are a painter, you can help with the paint job. If you know how to install solar energy, help with that. Whatever your forte is, feel free to jump on board the build team! The easiest way, is to financially contribute and spread the word using the share tools on the indie-go-go page! Thank you for taking time to check out this project! I am very excited to show you the process and final product!
