story:
Why Yak Hats? Exercise Your Freedom!

We've been thinking about our core values; the 'why' behind the 'what' of Yak Hats.  It didn't take long to discover that freedom, an active lifestyle and time well spent with the people you love is what we value most.  Add to that a bit of a rebellious spirit and a disdain for convention and you have Yak Active, llc.

Because this is who we are, it was only natural that we would want a wearable tech that gives us the freedom to enjoy outdoor activities with the ones we love.  That is why we invented the Yak Hat.  We love em, and we think you will too!

What are Yak Hats?

Have you ever tried to listen to music or take a call while out for a ride or on a run? There is a lot of gear out there to help, but it may not look cool or feel comfortable and fiddling with wires while you are playing outside is a hassle. 

Ever tried to talk on the phone outside? If there is any wind, even in the slightest breeze, you have to use the hand cup...  

"Can you hear me now? No? (hand cup over the phone receiver)  How about now?" 

Now you're using two hands to talk on the phone instead of one! How about no hands? Wouldn't it be great to talk hands free? We've been there, so we developed the Yak Hat. Wireless Bluetooth technology so you can listen to music and talk on the phone while staying active. 

Yak Hats are a functional, hidden piece of tech, that flows naturally with your active lifestyle.  We designed them to be a natural extension of who you are.  Also, the patent pending microphone adds a cool factor that rocks. With the Yak Hat, you can talk on the phone, hands-free, in wind speeds up to 40 mph.  How do we know? We tested it in the back of a speeding truck. Check out our video to see for yourself. It's pretty freakin' awesome!

Rather than wear a Bluetooth headset, that makes you look like a Cyborg, or trying to use your speakerphone in your shirt pocket, we developed the Yak Hat with integrated controls and ear buds that can be stowed away when not in use. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed our prototype phase and are moving forward with our Beta release.  Your fully functioning hat will be one of the first to come off our production lines in China and we look forward to hearing your feedback!

  • Our immediate goal is to raise funds to supplement our first order.
  • Help fund our project and you will receive one or two hats based on your sponsorship level.
  • Buy a Yak Hat as a gift and receive a card via email.  Personalize and send, just in time for Christmas! (Delivery estimate = February.)
  • Participate in our referral program and receive ONE EXTRA HAT in your shipment at no additional charge!

How it works (this is killer)

The Yak Hat comes with Bluetooth 4.0 integrated into the hat to offer wireless connectivity to your Smartphone with the highest quality available.  Our microphone is killer!

No more issues with trying to talk on the phone with background or wind noise.  The Yak Hat's unique design ELIMINATES wind noise during your phone conversations in wind speeds up to 40 mph! Check out our video which shows the 'wind test' in the back of a speeding truck!  This feature alone makes the Yak Hat an awesome way to stay connected while you are outdoors and on the move.

There are buttons inside the bill of the hat which control: 
  1. Power on/off, phone answer/hang up, and pause music
  2. Volume up/down and skip song


The removable earbuds can be pulled down for wearing, or flipped up onto the bill for quick storage (using built-in magnets). 
Yak Hat comes with a 6-hour rechargable lithium battery.  You'll hear a low battery warning when there is ~ 30 minutes of battery remaining.  To recharge, simply plug the USB charging cable into the audio jack located on the hat (see photo for detail).  Estimated charging time is 2 hours to reach a full charge.  You'll know that it's finished charging when a blue light appears inside the bill.

The Impact

The Yak Hat's revolutionary wind eliminating microphone will keep you connected with your friends while you are staying active!  No other Bluetooth product can offer this type of freedom.  Enjoy your favorite music without wires, and stay active with Yak Hats!  We are into living healthy lifestyles and enjoying our time outdoors, and want to help other people do the same.

What's Next

After we receive feedback from this Beta, we at Yak Active plan to launch our wearable Bluetooth solution more broadly, and will be working on:
  • Additional hat styles; running, trucker, bucket, etc. 
  • Patent pending on integrated controls design
  • Bluetooth certification & logo usage
  • Packaging
  • Marketing & merchandising costs
  • Additional legal & customs fees as needed

Risks & Challenges

Because this will be our Beta launch of Yak Hats, we have some risks which we will continue to manage, including:

  • Production or shipping delays
  • Capturing your feedback to help improve the Yak Hat experience

Other Ways You Can Help (and get rewarded for it)

Check out our Referral Bonus to learn how to get 1 extra Yak Hat at no additional charge!  Spread the word to your friends to help us find more folks to be Beta testers while running, cycling, skating, working around the house, or just cruising around town!

story:
Background Story

As many of you are aware, Ebola reached Sierra Leone in late June. I was hoping it would end quickly, but it hasn't. The issue is becoming more serious and those who are not affected directly by the disease are indirectly effected via inflation, civil unrest due to hunger and lack of work, stress from superstition and lack of knowledge, etc.

As a response to the hunger crisis occurring all across the three severely effected countries, Sierra Leone, Guinea and Liberia, I am going to send food aid to every house in the small, rural village, Bonganema, where I worked last year. With your help, we can sustain 300 people for the next 3 months while their own rice crops mature.


The Budget Break-Down

Rice & Fees

There are 49 houses and each bag currently costs $40. Because I cannot send them the rice directly I have decided to send the money via **Western Union to people that I personally trust.
**I have to use WU because they are the only international money exchange service available in both Bartlesville, OK & near Bonganema in Sierra Leone. 

These costs:

Rice: 49 X $40 = $1,960

Western Union Fees: per transfer: $5.00 OK Tax; 10% (USA) WU Fee; $6.98 (SL) WU Fee. (4 Transfers) = $243.96

Total Rice & Fees = $2,203.96

Transportation

This part is hard to determine simply because their economy is so unpredictable at this moment. In my opinion, the safest route would be to rent a truck on at least two different occasions. This will cut out the risk associated with being out in public (around hungry people) with a TON of money and a literal half ton of rice. The price to rent the truck will have increased, as well as the price of gasoline.

Potential Fee for renting a truck for 2 days (considering inflation of gas prices) = $300

The Cool Part

Here's the best part of all of this: I already have about $1,000 in donations! So the actual amount I need to complete this project is:

2,203.96 (Rice & Fees) + $300 (Transport.) - $1,000 (existing) = $1,503.96 (compensation for IndieGoGo) =

$1575.00 - That's all we need to feed 300 people for 3 months!


The Impact

Why Bonganema?

In Sierra Leone living in a rural area means you are automatically cut-off from major junctions of trade, typically market style, open air venues. This means you pay more for the food vs. the price the people in the city/ towns pay because of the transportation costs associated with physically getting to the market. During this crisis the number one issue is hunger due to inflated prices of imported staples such as rice, flower, and petroleum. Hunger is the number one issue that leads to civil unrest, violence, abuse, etc. in underdeveloped regions.

I spent very long hours with these people during parts of the year when food and water are scarce. I understand who becomes desperate and who uses their wisdom to solve problems for the greater good. Every penny of your donation will go to ensuring these people are properly fed, allowing them the ability to stay in their village during this time of great uncertainty.

What we're doing: Strategic Planning

Here’s an outline of the plan and the reasoning:
*Please keep in mind: When you are in an underdeveloped country and have more resources than the rest of the population, it’s important to try and hide that fact.

Step 1: Send the money in specific amounts to different people in Sierra Leone. By sending it to different people they will not see the same person going into the Western Union continually, this cuts down the risk of getting robbed coming out of the western union. The amounts will be sent in less than $500 to avoid large fees with Western Union as well as slow travel of the money across the Atlantic.

Step 2: Let the villagers decide how and who to rent a truck from. This is a trust factor and it's important for me to let them figure this out. I want them to rent a truck to minimize contact with other individuals as well as decrease waiting time in public places. This will decrease potential sickly exposure and getting robbed (notice a trend?)
They will probably need to go Bo several times; we're talking about a literal half-ton of rice. So I don’t want the same people to go twice, maybe hiring a different drivers will be part of the deal. This cost is estimated in the transportation section of the budget.

Step 3: Let only the 4 people know what’s going on with the money and flow of the situation. Mr. Kein, the village youth director, Aunty Daneh, my mommy, Michael Vandi, the youngest chief, and Mohamed son of my Mende teacher. 
These people will keep track of the money collectively so that if one person puts the money in their pocket, 3 other people will know what is going on.

Step 4: Try to get some photos of the feast :)

They mention on the phone on September 26th that Freetown is completely cut-off because of issues with Ebola. However, it is still safe for them to travel to Bo, another major city not yet drastically hit by the virus. There is hunger and crisis occurring in this region. There are always reasonable risks associated with this type of situation, but with strategic planning and frequent communication between now and the time the campaign ends, we can guarantee we're taking every precaution necessary to ensure a smooth delivery!


Other Ways You Can Help

Want more info? Visit Gondwana International LLC’s Facebook page to see what’s going on in the world. We have also formed a mailing list to keep people updated bi-weekly during for the next month during this challenge, please e-mail GondwanaIntlLLC@gmail.com if you would like to be a part of this newsletter.

All of this started as international studies projects out of Oklahoma State University. Gondwana International LLC is a business started at OSU, now owned by Liberty, that offers scholarships to students doing study abroad projects related to food, water, energy and education. Many local donations have been taken via doing business with us, and we greatly appreciate all of the support we have had this year, last year and thus far during the #RiceBagChallenge. If you would like more information on my previous projects or on this project, please feel free to e-mail the above address.

Thanks!! – Liberty

Many local donations have been taken via doing business with us, and we greatly appreciate all of the support we have had this year, last year and thus far during the #RiceBagChallenge. If you would like more information on my previous projects or on this project, please feel free to e-mail the above address.
Thanks!! – Liberty

story:
=====MAJOR UPDATE ====CHECK THE UPDATES PAGE TO KNOW HOW TO WIN A CONTRACT OF 1500 EURO!!!!

 

“Together We Fashion”: bring your words and faces to the catwalk.

I am Natasha, a young fashion designer living in Holland. For my next spring summer collection for NATA RYZH that will be shown in Amsterdam Fashion Week in July 2013, I want to create something very special. I want to merge fashion with social networking by designing and producing a collection made by the community for the community. I call it: Together We Fashion.

And this is how we will do it:

Made by the community:

You send me a picture of your face or your beloved one's, a word or a sentence which has a special meaning to you like a short poem or your favorite quote. I will then use your input with a great creative team to design and produce a beautiful fashionable print for fabric, that I will use for the garments that will be worn by models on the catwalk in July! With your words and your faces!  A politically correct collection, each of you matter, each of you are part of it, like you are part of this world.

Made for the community:

I will employ young fashion industry creatives which will be paid with your contribution. Seamstresses, pattern cutters, photographers, print and graphic designers, all will work together to make it a success! Let’s bring fashion to another level and have fun with it while creating employment opportunities!

 

What I Need & What You Get

Check out the perks, depending on the contribution you can go from be mentioned on my website to receiving invites for NATA RYZH fashion show, receiving a beautifully printed silk scarf or a silk designer limited edition dress specially made for you! If you are a man, there will be a specially designed fashionable shirt for you. 

Here are the images of the silk scarves colour variations that you can receive:

Model A Silk Scarf 110x30 cm, in black and white or pink and blue

 

 

and Model B Silk Scarf 110x30 cm, in black on white or white on black

 

 

Here are the AW2014 NATA RYZH dresses. You may chose between , left from right, the silk dess A, silk dress B or silk dress C

 

AND THAT’S NOT ALL!!

COMPETITION

I will select the most original 3 pictures or quotes and will send you a very special gift such as this scarf from AW2014 collection.

 

 

AS WELL A PROMOTION PRIZE:

Please promote this project by sharing on facebook!

Please LIKE this page, and state why you think this project is so great when sharing it on your wall:

http://www.facebook.com/TogetherWeFashion 

 

As a gift for the most original and active promotion, you will receive this beautiful Heart neck piece from NATA RYZH AW2014 collection for FREE.

 

 The MOST INFLUENCIAL Sales contributer PRIZE


Yet another wonderful gift is a designer NATA RYZH silk emerald green dress from the 'Rooted Heart' collection, please see below the image.

This FREE prize will be sent to a person who will contribute collectively ( meaning the person who will influence the most people to actually donate money for this project!) Do not worry if you can only support little by little, what I will look is the total contribution from the largest group! So get you friends involved and if each contributes a little bit, you as a initiator will get the prize!

How will I know who is the winner? Very simple:

Once you contribute, any ammount is good, then your friends when contributing should leave a message in the comments to support you:

example: Ivan Green 5 EURO for Maria Banks,  Dress Nata Ryzh competition

I will then count the donations and the total number of contributors and will send the winner this beautiful silk one size ( fits from 36 to 42) dress from NATA RYZH:

 

Your money will cover these costs:

Description

Cost in Euro

Material costs (atelier, fabrics, machinery, shoes, accessories etc)

 7,502

Printing costs to print your faces and words on the fabric

12,100

Photographers, video editing, graphic designers

12,100

Public relations and marketing costs

8,470

20 models + makeup and hair stylist

 14,520

Seamstresses and pattern makers which help me putting it all together

12,100

Production costs of the garments once prototypes are created

15,100

Amsterdam fashion week venue cost

18,150
     

 

 The Impact

Please remember: your contributions will go to support this project and to support my business start up and give it a future! It will create a platform in my town for the young professionals to work and develop. These contributions will help me to build a fair and sustainable business. Please contribute and spread the word, because TOGETHER WE FASHION!

 

A bit of my history and explanation as of why your contribution is very important to me:

  • In 2006 I have earned a Master of Arts at the Central Saint Martin design college in London and had several working experiences in Prada, Karen Millen, BOUDICCA and as designer assistant for several international designers in the Netherlands.
  • I was born in USSR, immigrated to Europe in 1994, in 2009 I became a Dutch citizen, which took 10 years of hard work and dedication.
  • While working full time as employee of the fashion industry to pay my bills I have been using my nights and weekends to nurture my dream and I managed to show two collections at the past Amsterdam Fashion weeks using my own money.
  • Since 2010 I have been starting my business funding it on my own but because of the difficult economic and industry situation I didn’t really manage to gather the funds needed for me to grow organically and independently.
  • You can check my previous creations, and maybe contact me to buy them  at www.nata-ryzh.com
  • In the future I would like my fashion ideas to be closer to the people, I would like to create a good value beautiful products with respect to the community and the environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute with money:

  • Please share my links
  • Please use the indiegogo share tools

If you have another form of support or donation in mind, please contact me at info@nata-ryzh.com

Please contribute and spread the word, because TOGETHER WE FASHION!
 
A bit of my history and explanation as of why your contribution is very important to me:

In 2006 I have earned a Master of Arts at the Central Saint Martin design college in London and had several working experiences in Prada, Karen Millen, BOUDICCA and as designer assistant for several international designers in the Netherlands.
I was born in USSR, immigrated to Europe in 1994, in 2009 I became a Dutch citizen, which took 10 years of hard work and dedication.
While working full time as employee of the fashion industry to pay my bills I have been using my nights and weekends to nurture my dream and I managed to show two collections at the past Amsterdam Fashion weeks using my own money.
Since 2010 I have been starting my business funding it on my own but because of the difficult economic and industry situation I didn’t really manage to gather the funds needed for me to grow organically and independently.
You can check my previous creations, and maybe contact me to buy them  at www.nata-ryzh.com

In the future I would like my fashion ideas to be closer to the people, I would like to create a good value beautiful products with respect to the community and the environment.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can’t contribute with money:

Please share my links
Please use the indiegogo share tools
If you have another form of support or donation in mind, please contact me at info@nata-ryzh.com

story:
It's a mirror watch

You can see the time on RANG. The hour hand light stays still and the minute hand blinks. You can select the color of the hour and the minute in RANG App.  Regardless of when, you can look at yourself and tell the time from the mirror watch RANG. You don’t have to take out a mirror from the bag or wallet. Check yourself by a mirror watch RANG.  This is a miracle. The handy mirror-cle RANG.


Use it without Looking! Just push RANG, Nobody knows it.

This is the world Quickest, Easiest, and the most Safe way to notify.  Anytime, Anywhere, Anyone! "I am here, I am okay, I am on the way."

Have you ever imagined touching on a little screen on your wrist? NO!  You do not need to check on a little screen with hurting your eyes. You do not need to find a button! Just push RANG!  Also you can  use it besides your hands. This is a mandatory function for everyone! We made it easy, fast,and simple. Just push RANG when you want to notify the current location, find a phone, take a selfie, and voice recording.


Free form style

You can use RANG in various forms  and easily interchange as bracelet, keychain, and necklace. It's possible to make your own DIY smart watch.


/ Keep your family safe /

When you want to inform others where you are about, just hold on to RANG. When you want to notify your family or loved that you are okay, just hold on to RANG. Your current location is sent to them and they will feel relieved. You can do this through numerous  complex steps in a smart phone. However, RANG only has one step. You can push it long to call family or loved automatically in emergency. The similar devices have a shutter button. It is convenient but frequently makes mistake in pressing button unintentionally. But Rang has four sensors embedded into the device. Therefore, a light hold of the device will inform the location and minimize the possibility of misusage when running the function.

/ Handy & Easy /

Just push RANG when you want to take a selfie. It's so easy and fast.

/ Let's have fun /


You can enjoy RANG by playing hand motion game.This is good for blood and energy circulation. Also it prevents cardiovascular disorders and dementia. Regardless of where you are at, use RANG to insure your health by enjoying it.  A balloon game is the one of the games that we provide. The game starts by clenching on RANG. You have to insure the balloon gets bigger and bigger just before it pops. 

 

If It is difficult to express verbally, just use fireworks emoticon and express your feeling. Without using your phone, just push RANG. Sending as "OK?".  Receiving as "OK!" or "NO!"  This is one of the ways of emoticon chatting. This is fun, so try it.  


/ RANG UI /






* You will receive a email survey to choose the color during the campaign. If you don't respond the email, we will select a random color for you. (not DIY package)

* If you are a distributor, please contact info@dnx.kr.


/ DIY Procedure /

We provide only RANG's main device to create your own RANG! Use it to create a unique style! Present the only smart watch to the people near you! 

/ Stylize RANG by yourself /


/ A warm-hearted mother and her daughter : I gave RANG as a gift to my daughter. Then I asked her to try on "I’m okay" function when she went out with her friends. So she informed me where she was at. I was pleased that she considered me. Also "I’m okay" sign made me relieved because I could notice that she was out safe. So I think that RANG made closer with family. 

/ A man and his wife : In a crowded subway, it was tiresome to take out a phone from the bag on the way home from work. I fist clenched RANG to show my wife where I was at. She was happy to see where I was at because my wife could prepare dinner for me on time. Furthermore, sometimes my wife sends cheer-up fireworks to me when I struggle in working, so I was glad.

/ Parents struggle on smart phones : My parents don’t know how to use a smart phone. Especially my mom barely sends messages to me. So when she is out, I get numerous spelling mistakes messages from her. It’s hard for my mom to use a keypad to send messages. Therefore, she needs RANG because she can send a warm-hearted emoticon easily. 

/ A memorable moment : There were times when I took a picture to make a good memory. But it was hard for me to make everyone in the picture. So I used RANG to take a selfie and it was convenient for me. 

/ A mischievous boy and his mother : At one time, I was looking for a phone after watching a movie with my son but I could not find where it was. Also I put it on silent mode in the theatre and that made it more difficult to find. So I used "finding my phone" function and the phone rang so loudly from my son’s bookshelf. So later I found out that my son secretly took out a phone from me to play a game and left it on the small gap between the bookshelf.  Nowadays, my son forgets where he left his phone and frequently asks where it is. Later on the day, he tends to find it in unexpected place.

/ Daily usage of finding phone : My friend was holding my phone to see the pictures on smartphone in the restaurant. Then few minutes later, I rummaged around in my bag for phone. But it was not there. So I went back to the washroom to see if I left it there. Still, I could not find it anywhere. So I used RANG, “find phone” function. The music started to play from my friend’s hand. She had the phone. The phone was under my very eyes. I thought to myself that in life, there are times when I just can’t see things right in front of me. 

/ One touch call : I suddenly realized to call my hubby while I was driving because I had to tell him to pick up our daughter from school.  Instead of taking out a phone from the bag, I held on to Rang with my right hand and it automatically called to my hubby. When he answered, I told him to pick her up. Even though this was not the case of emergency, Rang was very handy because I could easily call someone when doing something.


* Starting from next year,the  transportation card will be available only in Korea .

/ DNX 

DNX is an acronym for “Design for Next eXperience”. It focuses on making wearable devices in the next generation. It is distinguished from existing smart watch and band types. Therefore, we provide a new experience and a new value. 

/ CEO 

The CEO has majored in computer science and achieved PhD. She has worked in a laboratory and information and communications company over 10 years. Currently, she is a professor in Kaywon University of Art & Design. The research of IT and design convergence has been started since. She tried to bring out the solutions of how she could creatively integrate technology and design. As a result, she created RANG and established the company this year.  

/ What is RANG 

RANG is a fashionable jewelry smart watch. We especially designed the product that’s suited for women. People can stylize the item in various ways like bracelet, necklace and key chain. There are safety functions for women and practical convenient functions. In addition, we have various emoticons and games for fun. All the functions can be done by one touch fist clenching. Furthermore this does not require charging.

/ What made RANG

It’s a pity that existing products did not meet its growth potential in the wearable market. At present, the most of wearable devices are led by IT companies due to technology and function based. However, we combined computer science with design convergence experiences and produced a fashion centered practical wearable device. We wanted to emphasize on different needs to the users. 

/ How RANG differentiates

All the touch sensors are embedded in the inner part of the device. There are 18 types of controls that can be done in one touch. The product has patent registrations. Also it will take double amount times for other companies to duplicate the product. Therefore, we are proud of RANG’s technique of being the only one. 

/ What were some difficulties while developing the product

The most difficult parts were key sensing algorithms and designing mechanisms. We made many prototypes and spent last two years preparing the product. By separating the upper and lower parts we have expanded the ways to wear the product. We emphasized cost reduction, aesthetic impression, and one touch UI.

/ How to get after service

Basically, we won’t bring out the product that requires after service. However, when the after service is needed, we will exchange it to the finished product. 

/ Vision

RANG is pretty and practical in daily life. Therefore, it is a perfect gift to the friend or family. We want users to wear the product and be happy with it. We will bring out more outstanding wearable smart device. Overall, we want RANG to be loved by the fashionista as well as the product to be acknowledged as being the number one in the market. 

/ DNX manifesto

The members of DNX suggest their opinions on debates, discuss positively,  and tries to find the best solutions all together.


In GMV2015 (Global Mobile Vision) conference, DNX's CEO had a presentation in front of the audience. They were interested in the concepts and functions of RANG. As you may be aware, KES (Korea Electronics Show) is one of the most confidential organizations in Korea. Luckily, DNX received an award as the best new product in KES 2015. 


Please contact info@dnx.kr with any questions or requests.

Q. Does RANG supports Android and iOS?

A. Yes, However, due to iOS security policy there are some restrictions.  (SOS phone calls. Finding phone, Recording, Changing ringtone/vibration, Notifications)

Q. Can RANG be used by itself?

A. No, you must have over Android 4.3 and iOS 7.0 to connect your phone. 

Q. Can I find a phone when it’s on silent mode?

A. Yes, even though a phone may be on silent mode, it always rings. 

Q. Do I need to charge RANG?

A. Since it uses a coin battery (CR2032), it does not require charging. 

Q. Can I exchange the battery?

A. Yes, you can buy a coin battery in the market and exchange it easily. 

Q. Can I use I’m okay, SOS even though the opponent does not have RANG?

A. Yes, if you has Android it’s possible. But If you has iOS, your opponents also has to install RANG application(for free) and no need to buy RANG.

Q. Can I easily change the strap or bracelet?

A. Yes, also you can create your own bracelet by using the handmade accessories.  

Q. How can I select the color of my contribution?

A. You will receive a email survey to choose the color during the campaign. If you don't respond the email, we will select a random color for you.

Q. Is  the payment function internationally available?

A. No. It will be available only in Korea. We will announce the silicon strap with T-money later on. Therefore, the function is not accessible now.


Whatever the situation, we promise to keep open about how we're doing, and communicate frequently.

/ Minor change in design : There may be minor changes during stage of mass productions, so the product images may be different from the one that you’ve seen here. Especially handmade products can be different depending on the materials.   So please consider that when you purchase the products.

/ Delay in delivery : Since this is international shipping, there can be unexpected problems. So please consider that. If the product is omitted or delayed we will privately contact you to minimize the problem.


Contact

Home : http://www.rangs.kr/

Mail : info@dnx.kr

The members of DNX suggest their opinions on debates, discuss positively,  and tries to find the best solutions all together.




In GMV2015 (Global Mobile Vision) conference, DNX's CEO had a presentation in front of the audience. They were interested in the concepts and functions of RANG. As you may be aware, KES (Korea Electronics Show) is one of the most confidential organizations in Korea. Luckily, DNX received an award as the best new product in KES 2015. 



Please contact info@dnx.kr with any questions or requests.
Q. Does RANG supports Android and iOS?
A. Yes, However, due to iOS security policy there are some restrictions.  (SOS phone calls. Finding phone, Recording, Changing ringtone/vibration, Notifications)
Q. Can RANG be used by itself?
A. No, you must have over Android 4.3 and iOS 7.0 to connect your phone. 
Q. Can I find a phone when it’s on silent mode?
A. Yes, even though a phone may be on silent mode, it always rings. 
Q. Do I need to charge RANG?
A. Since it uses a coin battery (CR2032), it does not require charging. 
Q. Can I exchange the battery?
A. Yes, you can buy a coin battery in the market and exchange it easily. 
Q. Can I use I’m okay, SOS even though the opponent does not have RANG?
A. Yes, if you has Android it’s possible. But If you has iOS, your opponents also has to install RANG application(for free) and no need to buy RANG.
Q. Can I easily change the strap or bracelet?
A. Yes, also you can create your own bracelet by using the handmade accessories.  
Q. How can I select the color of my contribution?

A. You will receive a email survey to choose the color during the campaign. If you don't respond the email, we will select a random color for you.
Q. Is  the payment function internationally available?
A. No. It will be available only in Korea. We will announce the silicon strap with T-money later on. Therefore, the function is not accessible now.





Whatever the situation, we promise to keep open about how we're doing, and communicate frequently.



/ Minor change in design : There may be minor changes during stage of mass productions, so the product images may be different from the one that you’ve seen here. Especially handmade products can be different depending on the materials.   So please consider that when you purchase the products.
/ Delay in delivery : Since this is international shipping, there can be unexpected problems. So please consider that. If the product is omitted or delayed we will privately contact you to minimize the problem.

Contact
Home : http://www.rangs.kr/
Mail : info@dnx.kr

story:
My Story

WHO: chandra thuy tran
WHAT: i'm taking moonaheart to the next level!

moonaheart is a unique line of re-fashioned accessories and clothing

featuring one of a kind, hand-crafted layerings of salvaged materials

in brilliant colors, patterns, and textures!

WHEN: there's no better time than NOW! : )
WHERE: Oakland, CA
WHY: because moonaheart makes me come alive!

i've been inspired by a quote by Howard Thurman: "Don't ask what the world needs.

Ask what makes you come alive, and then go do it. What the world needs is

people who have come alive."
HOW: with your LOVE and support!


i am a lover of making things --- from hot pink pom pom earrings,

to a fabulous feast of fresh spring rolls, to a pair of kickin collaged

fire engine red cowboy boots.

Making and creating is my passion, and it has always been.

As a child, i collected little rocks and other debris from the beach,

taking them home to arrange and re-arrange and marvel at. 

Aside from my beach debris collections, on one occasion, i remember

feeling very pleased with myself after gluing half a styrofoam egg

inside a pale pink paper cupcake liner. i think it was the bizaareness

of this combo that really tickled me and has stuck with me since.


At the age of 11, i happened upon some blue and green plaid flannel

which was perfect for making boxer shorts, a popular clothing item among

my friends at the time. My mother taught me how to make and cut a pattern,

and to construct the boxers with her sewing machine. the rest is history!

i spent my adolescence turning my clothes inside out, tracing them to create patterns,

and reconstructing (sometimes successfully) my favorite clothes.

It didn't take me long to get adventurous, and soon i was re-fashioning

ready made clothes, which continues to be my passion. i cut them up,

add things to them, embellish them with lace or buttons or yarn. My favorite

is reinventing pieces ---- converting a skirt or pair of pants into a tube dress,

transforming a tablecloth into a pair of wrap pants, fashioning a fun neck

scarf from a collar and body of a regular ol' button down shirt, cutting off

sleeves and sewing them together to form a "sleeve scarf".

i've always dreamed of creating and selling my own line of designs, and NOW

i am taking the leap to make it a reality. i've already begun by opening my etsy shop online

(www.moonaheart.etsy.com) and selling moonaheart pieces at various shows.

A couple months ago, i realized that i had too much on my plate and that

moonaheart didn't have a chance at success if i didn't give it SPACE and

my undivided attention. To make space for moonaheart to flourish, i quit

a couple part time jobs that were providing predictable income. i am now fully

committed to taking moonaheart to the next level, and this is where YOU come in!
i can't do this by myself. as much as i've been trained to be independent

and self-sufficient and go it alone, i recognize that i cannot realistically do it alone.
i need and want your love and support on this journey.


So, here's how you can express your love and support:


What moonaheart Needs

To give moonaheart space to grow, i am beginning to rent a studio space,

and i could use help with the deposit and 1st month's rent.


To get moonaheart out there, i am applying to participate in shows

for the duration of 2011: Capsule Design Festival, Bazaar Bizarre, Renegade

Craft Fair, mini Maker Faire, Telegraph Ave. Holiday Street Fair, Rock Make Festival,

Alameda Antiques Fair.


To create a place where people can go to find out about moonaheart,

 i would like to have a website built.


To build the moonaheart brand, i'd like to have business cards made and

labels to sew into moonaheart pieces.


To create more moonaheart pieces, i'd like to buy more materials.


And, because i'm not a natural salesperson, i would LOVE to be able to pay someone
to assist me with selling at shows.


Here's the breakdown of how money raised will be spent:

- deposit + 1st month's rent for new moonaheart studio: $775
- fees for participating in Winter 2011 shows: $1346
- cost to build moonaheart website: $600
- business cards: $100
- labels for moonaheart pieces: $200
- materials for making new pieces: $500
- pay for salesperson for 12 Winter 2011 shows: $1200

Subtotal: $4721
Indiegogo fee 4% = $203
Credit card processing fees 3% = $152

Total Fundraising Goal: $5076


What You Get

I am offering lots of fun perks/rewards for your generous donations.
Check out the details and extensive list on the side!

Perks include:

- handwritten thank you note on limited edition hand-crafted moonaheart

postcard made from salvaged fabric + salvaged cardboard

- your name listed as Special Supporter on the new moonaheart website

- one of a kind moonaheart pieces. including:

- rosette pins
- helmet hat/coofie cap
- sleeve scarves
- circle scarves
- pom pom earrings
- postcards
- re-fashioned shirts
- wrist cuffs
- re-fashioned handbags
- heart pins

- a personal tour (in my vintage Mercedes that runs on veggie oil) of my

favorite places to find salvaged materials

- a private sewing lesson with yours truly to re-fashion a piece of clothing of your choice

- a custom made moonaheart piece of your choice

- an opportunity for the Spring 2011 moonaheart collection to be named after YOU!

What happens if i don't reach my goal?

if i raise up to $1000, the money will go to pay for moonaheart's new studio space
if i raise up to $2000, money will go to new studio space + fees for Winter shows
if i raise up to $3000, money will go to new studio space + fees for Winter shows +

website+ biz cards + labels
if i raise up to $4000, money will go to new studio space + fees for shows +

website+ biz cards + labels + new materials



Other Ways You Can Help

The greatest gift you can give me is sharing my fundraising campaign
with anyone who might be interested. I would deeply appreciate your
spreading the word as widely as you can ---- by email, on facebook,
and any means you can think of!

Also, if you're not able to make a monetary contribution at this time,
please consider these avenues of supporting me:

- volunteering time to help me with tasks in my studio, such as, cutting
fabric, managing projects, simple sewing construction, research, organizing
my studio, running errands, drinking tea, snacking on the job : )

- photographing moonaheart pieces in fun creative ways to produce great photos

- modeling moonaheart pieces in photo shoots or introducing me to people
who would be great moonaheart models

- styling for moonaheart photos --- helping me find fun creative ways to arrange
moonaheart pieces for photographing with or without models

- copywriting for moonaheart etsy descriptions, website, etc.

story:
JOCAR is a reflection of ideas that stemmed from cousins Lorenza Awal and Felipe Patterson, two cousins that merged their creativity and sense of style to create unique fashion possibilities.

 
Why Jocar?
 
Jocar is a mirror for who was, who we are and what we are here to represent
 “JO”CAR: Our Great Grandfather Jose came from Puerto Rico to New York with little to nothing but his name and family in tote. His then blushing wife Carmen JO"Ca"R, reared our family raising 7 children under the Ramos name. JOCA"R"
 
Since New York is where it all began for cousins Lorenza and Felipe, it’s only fitting to name our venture as close as we can to where it all began. New York born cousins Felipe and Lorenza may live on opposites sides of the map however, the creativity and passion knows no limits. With Lorenza residing in Ft. Lauderdale Florida and Felipe Patterson in St. Paul Minnesota there is not much time to personally connect however the inner spirit creativity and determination for success drives them to truly collaborate and make Couture Urban Wear. To be able to dress the world in our perspective of what urban wear is, is what we set out to do. 

We turn to indiegogo because we are in pursuit of obtaining a monetary foundation that will allow us to launch our Clothing line.

If we reach our goal of $3,000, we will:

The cost for ink and the T-shirts canvas to produce 100 of the M@d Sc!ent!st shirts comes to roughly $1,200.

We will also be printing out business cards stickers and t-shirts with our main logo (in the colors Green, Black, Red & Blue) this will total to $1,000. 

With the left over $800 we will use this money to fund our launch party (Location to be determined). This money will help secure the location and pay for the dj and mc that will host the night. We also would like to hand out free glow in the dark jocar t-shirts to the first 75 people that come to the launch party.  

If we exceed our goal, that extra money will be used to create door prizes for those that attend the launch party. Jocar stickers, baller bands and MORE SHIRTS!!! Who doesnt love a free t-shirt?

I myself as a designer have been influenced by many other forms of art whether it be music, poetry or movies. I hope that I can influence the next artist and show by example that if you work hard towards a goal anything is possible.

We have had two prior projects that were successful and both are postedd on our blog page ( jocarclothingllc.blogspot.com). They are called the Jocar Experiments, Lorenza and I like to think of ourselves as mad scientist of design. Our creations or as i call them Cre8ions are bright and sometimes off the wall, so I feel the theme fits quite well. The first Experiment took place at a local night club downtown Minneapolis, MN. Roughly 45 of my collegues gathered at Spin Night club all wearing the Jocar Experiment t-shirts and we took over the night club. It was a very wonderful sight to see.

The next Exterpiment was performed on facebook, for 24 hours we had roughly 75 people from 4 different states in the US switch their profile pictures to our main logo and 10 of those 75 won a free Jocar t-shirt. From this our fan page had a 150+ "like" spike. This was also nice to see how word of mouth could spark a mini movement

Other Ways You Can Help

We know the times are hard so if you can not contribute monetarily that is understandable. You can still help! Pass the word to a friend, we know word of mouth goes a very long way. Every little bit helps. 

 

Thank you very much for taking the time to look into our world and viewing our project.   

 

                                        Our Mission is to be;

"A Clothing Company that is drivin to inspire others by incorporating their life's influences and innovation into every design."

Thank you very much for taking the time to look into our world and viewing our project.   
 
                                        Our Mission is to be;
"A Clothing Company that is drivin to inspire others by incorporating their life's influences and innovation into every design."

story:
VNB is a small photo gig offering unique workshops in Film Photography in all formats and genres in Vancouver, BC.

Since January 2011, their Fine Art Film Photography workshops have steadily grown in both size and reputation, and so it only makes sense now for VNB to take the lead and bring back to the Vancouver’s film photography community something that has gone missing for far too long: public darkroom facilities!

Meet VNB’s Independent Eco Darkroom space project: “Halides & Gelatins”

The last operating public darkroom in Vancouver was called the Darkroom Co-op and it definitely closed its doors just one month before VNB landed in Vancouver in October 2011. Virginie & Bastien have been itching to do something about it ever since then, so when the just-right commercial lease opportunity showed up, they simply had to make a run for it! That is exactly what is happening today with this fundraising campaign.

VNB in VANCOUVER: ECO-MINDED FILM PHOTOGRAPHY

At this point you might think, sure, being able to rent darkroom time whenever needed in a dependent, cost effective, reliable, well administered and well maintained independent space is great. Out-of-enrollment photo students will appreciate it, just as much as visiting film photographers, and of course all of Vancouver’s many occasional film shooter and film aficionados! But the Halides & Gelatins darkroom project doesn’t just stop there. VNB wants it to be unique and to reflect all good things about Vancouverites: their artistic talents, their daring outdoorsy way of life, their genuine friendliness and hospitality, and last-but-not-least their firm commitment to ecological awareness and nature preservation.

And so with Vancouver’s Greenest City 2020 Action Plan in mind, the VNB darkroom is to be developed from the start as one of the most ecologically responsible darkroom photography facility in BC. Now don’t get them wrong, they’ll work on top friendliness too, but in the meantime what the Halides & Gelatins Darkroom is first and foremost about showcasing how much more ecologically friendly analog photography can get these days.

To do so, Virginie & Bastien are going to implement a green program that will govern the darkroom’s daily operations, while also defining its core artistic identity. Included in this green program will be state-of-the-art water and air filtration, extended use of non-toxic chemicals for all developing and printing processes (Eco-Pro and Legacy-Pro brands of photographic chemicals), diligent silver-recovery policies using a professional-grade silver-recovery unit, as well as the systematic recycling of good used working darkroom equipment available in and around Vancouver whenever possible. After all, why buy new equipment when loads of perfectly good-working enlargers and processing equipment are collecting dust in Vancouver’ garages & basements?

Lastly, VNB’s going will get even greener with cash donations to the Vancouver-based Raincoast Preservation Foundation courtesy of all recovered metallic silver from the darkroom! This could represent a yearly donation of $500 to $2000, as metallic silver recovered from photographic processes is quite pure! Who knew your silver could be gold to the environment? Darkroom members and users even have eco bragging rights at VNB!

HALIDES & GELATINS ECO DARKROOM DETAILS

Virginie and Bastien’s independent eco darkroom will be located at 1111 Commercial Drive (back street entrance). 

The Halides & Gelatins darkroom will:

• be approximately 1000 sq. ft. 

• give access to 8 separate printing stations (six 35mm & medium-format printing stations + two large-format printing stations) 

• offer 3 subscription levels (Key Holder Members: 8 spots only on a 6-month rotating basis - 24/7 access privileges, Weekly & Monthly Passes & Hourly Packages Renters - renters can purchase flexible number of hours at discounted rates, from a minimum of 8 hours to a maximum of 150 hours)

For more detailed information, please check our Darkroom Fundraising page.

To view the images offered in the perks, please check our B&W portfolio and our fine art portfolio.

Bastien & Virginie thank you in advance for your precious help, time, interest and support in helping them deliver the lasting hub and workplace that all Vancouverites impassionate about film photography culture need and long for!

Merci!

Bastien & Virginie

story:
Take us around the world and surprise yourself

The project

"What did we have in common? A dream, to be able to sail freely and to meet other beings and a nature that would make the question of life seem irrelevant."

Björn Larson, The Wisdom of the Sea.

A surprise for you...

We will surprise you. We will see places, we will meet people, and we want to offer you the chance to be part of it. At some point during our trip, we will be thinking about you, and we will find something that will surprise you!

We will keep you up to date during the whole trip: where we are, where we're heading, and so on. With text, pictures, and videos. But you never know when we might send a secret package to you! Half of what you give us is for yourself, in the form of something highly exotic and unexpected - a traditional handcrafted item? A typical piece of cloth? That is: not the mug or T-shirt that a colleague would bring back for you. We will take pictures and make records of what we're sending, and publish a comprehensive list at the end.

The point of all this is of course to surprise, but in order to avoid disappointing surprises you can, if you wish, send us a message to tell us what kind of object you'd appreciate (spices, music instrument,...) or if there are major contraindication we should know about (allergic to every red object, to aardvark hair, to Japanese sculpture,...).

...and a dream for us!

Because travelling is our shared dream, and because we need to take a few steps back from the education system, and more generally to think about our future in society, we would like to offer you the chance to be part of it so that we can share this dream with you.

The crew

We are both students, we are both curious, and we want to take a step back and see the world in a more intimate way.

Félicien Comtat

A post-graduate Mathematics student in France, yet extremely knowledgeable about nature. A book-lover, especially when it comes to philosophy, he will surprise you more than you would expect, even though I already told you that! After knowing him for several years I still get surprised by the way he sees things, and I can always trust him to come up with bright ideas.

Mathias Sablé

It's me! I am a post-graduate Computer Science student in France. Probably not as cultivated as my travelling companion, but I've been sailing for ages and I would like to do it as much as possible. I passed the Yachtmaster exam a few years ago, since then I have tried to sail on my own as often as possible. I always dreamed of sailing around the world! I also co-founded a sailing association with my fellow students.

The Yacht (insert boat name here)

It's one of the peculiarities of the English language. She. Small wonder, because she will be, for a long time, our home, our mode of transport, our way to accomplish our dream and our way of offering you what you didn't even know you dreamed about, she is most certainly a full-time member of the Crew!

An issue here

To be fair, we do not yet have a yacht. Although we have just enough funds for an old but steady second-hand yacht, we need funds for our other expenses (see below).

The good thing is that I have a few boats in mind already, and this would be the purpose of our first update in case of project success: to show you our brand new (old) boat!

I am currently looking in New Caledonia and Polynesia, and if you wonder why — look at the distance between France and New Caledonia and keep in mind that our goal is to travel to foreign places! Another reason is that a lot of people sail around the world and end their trip there, hence a high concentration of second-hand, relatively cheap boats there.

The trip


This trip may change soon depending on where the boat is when bought, and it may change at the last minute because of the weather forecast: no, we will not go through typhoons to take pictures for you!

The budget

Or why we're asking for this amount of money. Living entirely on a boat is not expensive. But we will stop and travel to various places, and mooring a boat somewhere for a few days quickly gets quite costly.

Estimated budget for a month:

  • We need to eat, and everything's done on the boat! $8 * 30 days * 2 people = $480
  • We will be moored about half the time and pay for nights spent in marinas, about $20/night: (1/2) * (30 days * $20) = $300
  • Even though we will be wind-powered most of the time, which is one of the cheapest ways to travel, we might have to use the engine from time to time, and fuel is expensive: about $20.
  • For vaccinations, visas and other formalities, (2 * $40) = $80
  • For communications (see below), about $20

And that's it. Obviously no hotel or plane or car rental.

So that's about $900 a month for two! Although we would love to travel for several years, we can only take a one year break, and allowing time for preparation it seems safe to say that we will only travel for 10 months. Which makes $9000.

We require a proper camera to film all this, and we currently do not have one (as you can tell from our promotional video up there), that's another $100 at least.

And because we need to communicate with you at any time, we will need a satellite phone that works about everywhere. I'm thinking about an Iridium 9505 for example, this is at least another $400 if we find a good deal.

That's about $9500 now.

But now the gifts come into the equation! As stated, half the price of what you give is for yourself. So let's double this up, we get $19000.

If there's extra money

All potential extra money would be used to find a better sailing boat. Which also means fancier pictures, a longer trip (because we would go faster), and so on!

Shipping

The price of shipping gifts will be included in the price of the reward. That being said, in many cases, we might wait until we are closer to you before sending them, or wait for a country where shipping prices are lower.

Bonus

Because we know you'll like it, and because we will probably change a lot during the trip, we will take a picture of ourselves every day in the same pose.

And if you have ideas of things for us to do, why not suggest them! I may very well dance at the top of the mast for you!

Credits

The picture used is from Lee Cannon, who published it under Creative Common https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/ (hence so is my version) and was cropped as well as whitened. Thanks Lee !

story:
Short Summary

A few words about me....
My name is Helena Michailidou from Greece.
I'm a believer of positive energy having strong faith in God ( universe)  and I have an optimist life outlook.
I will not repeat myself with the Greek crisis and unemployment; this happens in many other countries  around the world and in many other people besides me.
This general socio-economic crisis in my country affected me as well with the ending of a long professional cycle ( 23 yrs).
I had to start a new cycle (beginning)
Putting love and faith in my new project I started creating handmade amulet jewelries, using semi-precious stones for protection & empowerment.
The amulet jewelries are unisex ; I will provide you with indicative sample photos.
 I have opened a fb account

What I Need....

To develop my ideas and plans I'm asking for your financial contribution as I need to have my own workshop, to buy materials - which are expensive- , to expand the retail via e-shop as well as the wholesale.
I NEED THE VERY BASICS TO START OPERATING THIS SMALL BUSINESS WHICH WILL HELP ME  LIVE A LIFE WITH DIGNITY!!!
I AM ASKING YOU TO ASSIST TO CONTINUE MY SMALL BUSINESS!!!
(You can spread my campaign this will be also helpful you can share Tweet or even tell to your friend to support me.)

What You Get....

All of my amulet jewelries are unique like every individual is unique; also gemstones do not resemble each other.
With a contribution of 35€  you get an amulet bracelet with a silver charm for protection plus a yearly 10% discount via e-shop,
With a contribution of 55€ ,70€, 85€ you get amulet necklaces with various silver charms for protection plus a yearly 10% discount via e-shop.
I would like to ' like' my facebook page with all your positive energy for a good start and continuation
P.S  All orders will be dispatched after the end of the campaign.

...... and remember,  law of reciprocity determines always our  lives in the long run ( the good brings good)
Thank you all; either you contribute or just out of curiosity read my brief story.
Wish you all the best with faith and positive energy on what you are doing.
Regards
Helena Michailidou

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

I am Katherine Walker, Fashion Designer and Owner of Yhta'k (ya-tay) Designs. Yhta'k Designs is a Contemporary-Better clothing line company originally from Chicago now located in Los Angeles.  I need your help in raising funds to attend our 1st Fashion Week! Recently, we opened our design studio in the L.A. Fashion District early in December 2015. This year marks our 7th year in business and we are growing and becoming a household name. Our brands include Katherine Marie misses, Madame Marie Curvy collection and MJW menswear line along with a new Pet wear line. 

We have been selected to showcase at L.A. Fashion Week in March 2016 and need funding for this great milestone as well as equipment and supplies.  For as little as $5, anyone who wants to support can make a contribution to Yhta'k and the industry. Also, you can obtain one of our logo tees for a donation of $25! We couldn't have chosen a better show which is connected to the Aids Foundation so your contribution will support AHF.  For the love of fashion and with over 20 years in the Fashion Industry, Katherine has grown Yhta'k from the bottom up and is constantly growing.

Please enjoy the video clip above of our 2nd runway show!  To learn more about us, and/or view current and past collections, Click here to access our Katherine Marie by Yhta'k Designs Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Katherine-Marie-by-Yhtak-Designs/144228858965120?sk=info&tab=page_info

Thank you and welcome to Yhta'k!

Katherine Walker, Yhta'k Designs


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 to attend L.A. Fashion Week this March. The cost for the runway show is $3,500 and $1,500 will be used for model fees and supplies.  

You can obtain one of our logo tees for a donation of $25!

The production of the runway show is connected to the Aids Foundation so your contribution will support AHF. 

If we don't reach our goal to its entirety, all monies raised will be used on our Fashion Week payment due.

The Impact

All contributors will not only make a contribution to the Fashion industry but to a great cause as well.  As we know AIDS is an well-known epidemic around the globe and a cure is still under research.  Your contribution to help us attend L.A. Fashion Week will also help find a cure for AIDS and support AHF.

Risks & Challenges

This is our 2nd fundraising campaign launch! Fundraising can be very challenging in reaching the monetary goal set and organizing a fundraising team.  We acknowledge these challenges and believe anything is possible and with the help of others who would like to support us, we will achieve our goal.  Over the last 7 years in business, we have grown substantially in successfully building our brands with a design team and hosting 3 private runway shows.  With the industry skills, knowledge and help from current supporters, Yhta'k will continue to expand.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support us financially, there's other ways you can assist us in reaching our goal by:
  • Sharing our campaign with your friends, family, and network 
  • Work as a team member on our fundraising campaign
*Remember to use Indiegogo share tools and support if needed.

story:
Riley Suchanek is a Los Angeles Fashion Designer. She will be showing her first collection at the Ad Hoc show at the end of this year.

Riley has her A.A. in Fashion Design. This will be her first collection since graduation. Designers that most inspire her are Rodarte, Acne, Celine, Dries Van Noten, and Chloe. Her mini collection is considered Abstract Specialty pieces for the contemporary womens market.

Everything from fabrics to models are in order. If you would like to invest in the beginnings of Riley's Fashion career, it would be greatly appreciated. Riley plans to build her portfolio with this mini collection.

Not only is Riley showing in the Ad Hoc Fashion show, she is also producing the show. Work has been scarce to find in the fashion industry at entry level. Therefore, Riley has decided to make her own experience to ad to her resume along side 5 other designers she hand picked to show their collections as well. 

The collection will be featured in Ad Hoc's archives.

 

If you are unable to contribute to Riley's Collection Campaign, don't fret! Check out updates on 

theadhoc.org

or

www.facebook.com/adhocoffical

 

for updates on the actual event. 

 

AD HOC WILL HAVE ITS OWN SEPARATE CAMPAIGN, COMING SOON

 

Thanks for taking the time to read, and thank you for your contributions!

story:
We're dog owners. We're active and busy. We've found a solution!

Let's be honest, there isn't anything incredibly complex or world changing about a Go Post.  But what makes this product special is it might let your dog spend a little extra time with you!  Whether it is traveling to a relative's house who doesn't have a fenced yard, camping in an area unfamiliar to the dog, or simply working in the front yard, the Go Post is the easy solution to ensuring that your dog stays in place!  Simply wrap the leash around a stationary object (current size allows easily for objects up to 4" in diameter--such as a lamp post, tree branch, hand rail) and clip in the dogs existing leash. 

Go Post Benefits:

Go Post is Affordable-No need to install a metal post in the yard, unwieldy chain, or expensive dog run.

Go Post Is Safer-No need to unleash your dog to tie them up.

Go Post is Very Easy to take along anywhere and so lightweight and strong it can be used in a variety of settings!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise enough money by offering you our unique Go Post product to be able to purchase additional equipment, material and services to expand to a broader market.

Goal 1:  Have a functional website designed, built, & launched.

Goal 2:  Acquire commercial grade sewing equipment to allow for quicker production cycles.

Goal 3:  Develop better marketing tools to enhance distribution capabilities to reach a broader dog ownership group.

 

Our Go Post product is available in Red, Blue, Black, Purple, Green, and Pink! (Actual colors pictured in our Gallery.)  Please let us know what color(s) you'd like when you donate to our campaign.

The Importance

Thank you, already, for reviewing our Indiegogo campaign.  These projects are truly investments of ourselves.  Your contribution to this campaign will have three major areas of impact! 

First, on the pet (or pets) you purchase the Go Post for.  This will hopefully allow them to get to travel with you and have experiences they might not have had otherwise.  Second, on other dogs!  As we re-invest and hope to reach a broader audience, a primary objective is to have our products enhance the lives and interactions of humans & dogs everywhere.  This passion starts with, but won't stop with, our Go Post product once it gets rolling!  Finally, on us--our investment of time, efforts, and capital will be constantly rewarded from your level of support.

The Business Side

Our goal is to enhance the lives of the pets and their relationship with owners by offering simple products that are not cost prohibitive. With 78.2 million dogs owned in the United States covering 39% of US households, this is a market that is very strong. On average, a US family will spend $58 per month on their pets.  We're hoping to be a small part of that and provide value added products!

The Go Post tether is made of high strength nylon webbing.  Nylon has several advantages over other types of webbing material, including that it is able to withstand "pulse" breaks due to its inherent elasticity--this means there is slight give in the tether to ensure it does not snap and fail if your pooch tries to chase down the bacon truck.  We use a heavy duty, commercial grade thread in the stitch with a pattern that is set to ensure maximum strength.  Finally, the carabineer is a mid-strength stainless steel in the pear shape to allow for full strength across the long axis.  All in all, the Go Post tether will easily hold 400 pounds which is greater strength than most leashes on the market.  Additionally, this strength is more than sufficient for most common, regular domestic dog breeds when considering their pull strength.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t financially contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  If you're interested in supporting our campaign please spread the link to our campaign (Indiegogo has some useful share tools) and tell your friends, family and coworkers that it might be worth a look!

Finally...once you've received your Go Post, we'd love to get some photos of it in use!  stay@letsgopost.com

First, on the pet (or pets) you purchase the Go Post for.  This will hopefully allow them to get to travel with you and have experiences they might not have had otherwise.  Second, on other dogs!  As we re-invest and hope to reach a broader audience, a primary objective is to have our products enhance the lives and interactions of humans & dogs everywhere.  This passion starts with, but won't stop with, our Go Post product once it gets rolling!  Finally, on us--our investment of time, efforts, and capital will be constantly rewarded from your level of support.
The Business Side
Our goal is to enhance the lives of the pets and their relationship with owners by offering simple products that are not cost prohibitive. With 78.2 million dogs owned in the United States covering 39% of US households, this is a market that is very strong. On average, a US family will spend $58 per month on their pets.  We're hoping to be a small part of that and provide value added products!
The Go Post tether is made of high strength nylon webbing.  Nylon has several advantages over other types of webbing material, including that it is able to withstand "pulse" breaks due to its inherent elasticity--this means there is slight give in the tether to ensure it does not snap and fail if your pooch tries to chase down the bacon truck.  We use a heavy duty, commercial grade thread in the stitch with a pattern that is set to ensure maximum strength.  Finally, the carabineer is a mid-strength stainless steel in the pear shape to allow for full strength across the long axis.  All in all, the Go Post tether will easily hold 400 pounds which is greater strength than most leashes on the market.  Additionally, this strength is more than sufficient for most common, regular domestic dog breeds when considering their pull strength.



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t financially contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  If you're interested in supporting our campaign please spread the link to our campaign (Indiegogo has some useful share tools) and tell your friends, family and coworkers that it might be worth a look!

Finally...once you've received your Go Post, we'd love to get some photos of it in use!  stay@letsgopost.com

story:
Baby Bernard - Linux on a stamp

Baby Bernard is a high performance embedded system board, featuring the following:

  • Ready to go Linux solution
  • Great for DIY engineers
  • Easy to use and install
  • Small form facor, Light weight and Simple design
  • Single 5V supply
  • Linux 2.6.35.3 pre-installed
  • Freescale MX28 processor, NAND flash, DDR2
  • UART, I2C, SPI, USB host, USB slave, Ethernet, TFT, ADC, DAC, GPIOs, ...

 

What can Baby Bernard used for

Baby Bernard is a high performance Linux based system in small form factor.  It can be used in Home Automation, Industrial Control, Automotive Control, Consoles, WIFI-Bluetooth gateway...  The most important that you can customerize your system by adding your hardware in short perioid of time.

Small form factor

Design example on Home Automation Console

Design example on WIFI-Bluetooth gateway

 

 

Why we need your help

We need enough funding to build 1000 pieces for our system optimization, cost go down, and get our broad compliance to FCC and CE (Laboratory charges are very expensive).

story:
About SenseTogether

We are a small group of university graduates majoring in sensor technologies.  During the several years of research, we found that most of the sensor products, although they are well appeared in the market:

(1) are not attractive and user friendly enough to encourage the users to use them regularly and frequently.  As a result, the sensor products could not perform their invented objectives well, and

(2) some of sensor applications are still being monopolized by professionals / organizations and cannot be released to the public at low cost.

For these reasons, we gathered

(1) to research and develop user friendly sensor applications to connect you to the community with your updated status, and

(2) to popularize professional sensor applications at low cost. 

If you share the same idea with us, please support us in setting up our own sensor laboratory, Sense Together Laboratory.  AlcoSense is the first project from us. 


Our first project - AlcoSense

AlcoSense is our first project. Research shows that most of the people over-estimate their alcohol tolerance. This inspired us for creating AlcoSense. 

With AlcoSense, you can

·  track your BAC; Blood Alcohol Content for measuring level of drunk

·  avoid being drunk before you overloaded

·  keep yourself a better drinking habit


How AlcoSense works

We implemented alcohol sensor and circuit board with BAC calculating capabilities. Our first prototype is to make a bottle-shaped tester.

It operates in a really simple way.
Just turn it on by a double tap and blow directly to the bottom of the bottle.

·  If the bottle turns RED -> You are OVER LIMIT! Please stop drinking

·  If the bottle turns GREEN -> You are under normal BAC 

AlcoSense included a CR2 battery which can drive AlcoSense working for > 1,000 times


SenseTogether Product Design

There is a special arrangement behind the products in order to achieve the missions of SenseTogether laboratory.

In our design, the bottle is mainly divided into three parts.


1. The top of the bottle (the top)
The top is a changeable data communication circuit responsible for transferring the data from the sensor circuit to smart phone.

2. The body of the bottle (the body)
The body is a power compartment for carrying charging circuit(s) and/or a battery.

3. The base of bottle (the base)
The base is a changeable sensor circuit(s) accountable to collecting the required data.

This setting could facilitate the user to change and apply:
  • various kind of communication means;
  • different ways to power the bottle; and
  • a large range of sensors to fulfill users sensing needs without buying the same communication circuit and power circuit again


Who need AlcoSense

  • Drinkers
  • Drivers
  • Wine Stewards 
  • EVERYONE - If you want to get noticed before drunk


Our Goals

We have already implemented our idea into prototype. What we want now is to raise enough fund and put the idea into real product.

· We need $10,000 to put AlcoSense into production and manufacturing.
We estimated the cost is around $10,000 for making our first 100 AlcoSense.

· We need $20,000 to make AlcoSense smaller, looks better and easier to carry
We will make it even smaller by minimizing the circuit board and re-design the case for better appearance and easier to carry.

· We need $30,000 to make a free app for AlcoSense Earjack Version
We will implement the ear jack version of AlcoSense with an app for tracking drinking habits and showing the actual BAC value in smart phone.

·  And more features are coming....

In the first round of fund raising, we would provide alcohol sensor only. Moreover, in the future, we would add several sensors into the base to extend the functionality of the bottle.


Our Updates

We will keep updating our project status here.
Please feel free to email us: sensetogether@gmail.com

story:
The FREE

The FREE is not a noun, it's a verb. Having the ability to escape into the open roads of paths less taken. The FREE is a way of life, a selection of people who understand that seeking safety in strangers and trusting that everything will work out is all that matters. Learning from the wide open trails and listening to the soundtrack of the wind blowing through your hair is the only one I want to know. Being FREE is a feeling one has in their soul - not something that can be given or taken away.

My freedom to be FREE was almost taken from me, along with my life, last year when I was the victim of a horrific motorcycle accident. Leaving me with nothing but a will to survive and the passion to continue on the road I once knew, is all I have left. I had my own clutch handlebar of my Harley Davidson impale my stomach and come out of my back - something you couldn't even imagine. My arm, shattered along with multiple burns from gasoline on the pavement. The road to recovery has only started - I am now left with my arm permanently at a 90degree angle and a wandering mind of "what could have been". Yet, i refuse to let the fire inside of me burn out. I am free... the open road is all that calls my name and I am going to get back on a bike when the time is right and feel the wind against my face. Until then, I have created something that incorporates everything I believe in... and I couldn't be happier. Let me introduce you to... the FREE.

The FREE is company that invokes the past - What "America the Beautiful" stood for... freedom, love, and exploration of beautiful lands unknown, engaging and appreciating all who you come into contact with while embracing their ideologies and learning from the teachers of the lands.


The Impact

This same passion for motorcycles, vintage memorabilia and everything to do with the things that made America strong, free and beautiful have inspired this line of mens clothing and accessories. Every shirt is hand printed by myself and my partner, while every aspect of leather crafting is done by me to not only insure quality - but also as an art therapy tool to help with my recovery from my accident. This line of specialty t-shirts made only for IndieGoGo are inspired by my accident and creating awareness for other riders as well. 

Buy purchasing these t-shirts you are providing awareness to riders and to motorists all around the country to WATCH OUT FOR MOTORCYCLES and that loud pipes, which get your attention, can and do save lives. Please let the riders ride, and let them live. Let riding a motorcycle be what its meant for - being FREE - and not just a death trap. Let Ride, Let Live. 

I personally thank you for looking twice and listening for motorcycles around you and appreciate you taking the time to look into this uncanny opportunity for me. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funding for this project will allow us to produce our line of men's clothing and accessories.  We will be able to purchase all materials necessary for production, i.e. t-shirts, leather and every little bit and piece for us to continue making our products by our own hands. We take pride in having all of our garments & accessories handmade by us in California, USA and would love to make sure this always stays as just that. Once we have a good amount of inventory we will be able to launch our website, get on the road and bring our shirts, koozies and key chains to music festivals and boutiques around the country - therefore continuing to support small business in America.

Breaking It Down:

  • Ideally our company would need about $10,00 for supplies, and start up costs.
  • You are contributing to a cause, while also getting a Made in USA vintage style garment and/or accessory. 
  • Fashion has great influence on not only those who wear it, but those inspired by it.
  • With little to no donations OR with a wonderful new following of donations - The FREE will continue to aspire to create a lifestyle brand that promotes "America the Beautiful" bringing back that American pride and nostalgia. 
  • The FREE is thankful for you taking the time to read into our cause - regardless of donations, we proudly thank you. 

TSHIRTS: FAQ

  • Is my t-shirt mass produced? No. All t-shirts are 'Made in USA' and hand printed by The FREE in our California, USA studio - giving each print its own character. 
  • What style are these shirts? The FREE is inspired by all things vintage and nostalgic USA - so all shirts are given that vintage-style look and appearance. Our moto is: "The more you wear it, the better it looks - don't be afraid to live FREE".
  • What are my style options? Option One: "Loud Pipes Save Lives". Option Two: "Don't Tread On Me".
  • What are my color options? The color options to choose from are: Option One: "Vintage Grey" & Option Two:"Classic Black". The print on the Vintage Grey shirts is Black & the print on the Classic Black shirts is White.
  • What are my size options? How is the fit? The size fits a modern style with a relaxed fit and loose crew neckline - sizes range from XS-XL

VINTAGE FLANNELS : FAQ

  • How do i choose my flannel color/style/size? All we need is your size - knowing that each flannel is handpicked by The FREE and each is different from the next. This is what gives the flannels such great character! They will all be from the 80s & 90s - modern fits without the modern labels - we strive to go for the vintage American "lumberjack/blue collar workforce" appeal, with our color pallets being reds, browns, blues, greens, neutrals. This process truly makes each garment one of a kind. 
  • Is my flannel mass produced? No. We, The FREE, are only releasing a limited edition amount of 50 flannels with the design "Loud Bikes, Fast Women, Old Whiskey" on the back. We hand print these designs in California, USA and each one is unique to itself. Once sold out, we will no longer be carrying this design - therefore keeping your flannel original and very sought after! Don't miss out!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Get the word out - tell your friends and family that they can help save lives.
  • Always look twice for Motorcycle riders.

For more information and to keep up with how we are doing....

FOLLOW US: #LivetheFREE
